content:
でんわばんごう〔電話番号〕
〈名〉The telephone number

content.content: お宅の電話番号は
What is your telephone number?

でんわりょう〔電話料〕
〈名〉The telephone charge

content:
と
〈接続詞〉And

content.content: 男と女
man and woman

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. With

content.content: 誰と行くか
With whom are you going?
これは皆の話と合っている
This agrees with all accounts.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: これはあれと合う
This differs from that.
彼を泥棒と間違えた
I mistook him for a burglar.
君のと交換しよう
I will exchange mine for yours.
人と別れる
to part from a man
水は氷と化す
Water turns into ice.
金と鉄とどちらが有用か
Which is the more useful, gold or iron?
彼は学校を出ると実業に就く
When he leaves school, he will go into business.
あの人の英語を聞くとまるで西洋人だ
To hear him speak English, one would take him for a foreigner.
損をしようとかまわぬ
I don't care if I lose.
誰がそう言おうと間違っている
Whoever may say so, it is wrong.
彼は学者だと聞いた
I have heard that he is a scholar.
彼は去る意無しと
He is not going to leave, I hear.

content:
と〔戸〕
〈名〉A door

content.content: 戸を開ける
to open the door
戸を開けて人を入れる
to open the door to people
戸が開いている
The door is open.
戸を開けておけ
Keep the door open!
戸が半分開いている
The door is ajar.
戸を半分開けておけ
Keep the door ajar!
戸を閉ざす、戸を締める、戸を立てる
to shut the door
人の口に戸を立てられぬ
People will talk.
戸を締めて人を入れぬ
to close the door to people
人を室内に押し込んで戸を締める
to shut the door on a man
戸をピシャンと締める
to bang the door―slam the door―shut the door with a bang
戸が締まっている
The door is shut.
戸を締めておけ
Keep the door shut!
戸を開け払う
to throw the doors open―open the doors wide
戸を開け放す
to leave the door open
戸に締まりがしてある
The door is fastened.
戸に締まりをしておけ
Keep the door fastened!
戸に錠がかかっている
The door is locked.
戸に錠をかける
to lock the door
人を室内に押し込んで戸に錠をかける
to lock the door on a man
戸に錠をかけておけ
Keep the door locked!
戸は掛金だけかけてある
The door is on the latch.
戸に掛け金だけかけておけ
Keep the door on the latch!
戸を叩く
to tap at the door―(は軽く、強くなら)―rap at the door
戸から入る
to enter ［go in, come in］ at the door
戸から出る
to go out ［come out］ at the door
この戸を開けると表へ出る、縁側へ出る、廊下へ出る、庭へ出る、応接間へ入る
The door opens―on the street―on the verandah―into the passage―into the garden―into the parlour.
僕の室の戸
the door of my room―the door into my room
戸の蔭に隠れろ
Hide behind the door!
彼は戸の蔭から出て来た
He came out from behind the door.
戸に指を挟んだ
I caught my finger in the door.
戸の口からちょっとも出られぬ
There is no stirring an inch out of doors.

content:
と〔堵〕
〈名〉A fence surrounding a house

content.content: 堵に安ずる
to live in peace
万民その堵に安んず
The people can now live in peace.
門前に集まるもの堵の如し
People crowded about the door.

content:
と〔徒〕
〈名〉A party; a set; a lot

content.content: 浮浪の徒
vagabonds―vagrants―tramps
不逞の徒
turbulent subject

と〔斗〕
〈名〉A measure of capacity (nearly four gallons)

content:
と〔途〕
〈名〉A way

content.content: 上京の途に上る
to start for town
赴任の途に就く
to leave for one's new post
渡米の途に就く
to leave for America
目下渡欧の途に在り
He is on his way to―en route for―Europe.
事業ようやくその途に就く
The work is fairly under way.

content:
と〔砥〕
〈名〉A whetstone; a grindstone

content.content: 道路は坦々として砥の如し
The road is level.

content:
ど〔度〕
〈名〉
1. (=幾度の度)(how many) times

content.content: 一度
one time―once
二度
two times―twice
一二度
once or twice
一二度ならず(幾度も)
several times
あんなところへは二度と行くまい
I will go there no more.
こんな機会は二度とあるまい
Such an opportunity may not occur again.
三度
three times―thrice
日に三度
three times a day
三度に一度は
once in three times
四度
four times
三四度
three or four times
月に四度
four times a month
五六度
five or six times
幾度
How many times?―How often?
幾度も
many times―several times―very often
幾度電話をかけても通じない
I rang him up ever so many times, but there was no reply.

content: 2. (=何度の度)(how many) degrees

content.content: 今日は寒暖計は何度だろう
How does the thermometer stand today?―How is the mercury today?
日蔭で九十度
The mercury stands at 90° (ninety degrees)―registers 90°―in the shade.
君の眼鏡は何度か
What is the number of your spectacles?
二十度
It is No.20.
度の強い眼鏡
spectacles of a high number
度を盛る
to graduate
度を測る
to measure
温度を測る
to take the temperature

content: 3. (=適度の度)moderation

content.content: 度を過ごさぬ
to use moderation―keep within bounds
酒は度を過ごさなければ薬だ
Wine, if taken in moderation, is good for the health.
度を過ごす
to go beyond (all) bounds―go too far―go to excess―(酒なら)―drink to excess
何事も度を過ごせば害になる
If you go beyond bounds in anything, it will do you harm―You can not indulge in excess with impunity―Every excess is a vice.
度を節する
to be moderate
飲食の度を節する
to be temperate (in food and drink)

content: 4. (=態度の度)self-possession; composure

content.content: 度を失う
to be disconcerted

content:
どあい〔度合〕
〈名〉Degree; extent

content.content: 度合を計る
to use moderation―be moderate―keep within bounds

content:
とあって
〈副〉As being

content.content: その本は風俗壊乱とあって発売禁止になった
The book was suppressed, as being injurious to public morals.

content:
とあみ〔投網〕
〈名〉A casting-net

content.content: 投網を打つ
to cast a net
投網打ちに行く
to go netting

content:
とある
〈形〉Certain

content.content: とある先生に聞いた
A certain teacher told me.

content:
とい〔樋〕
〈名〉A water-pipe; a conduit:(勾配付の樋)a chute; a shoot:(雨樋)a gutter

content.content: 樋で水を引く
to draw water by a pipe

content:
とい〔問〕
〈名〉A question; a query; an inquiry; an interrogation

content.content: 問いを問う
to ask one a question
問いをかける
to put a question to one
問いを発する
to propound a question
問いに答える
to answer a question

content:
といあわせ〔問い合せ〕
〈名〉Inquiry; reference:(=る) to inquire (of some one about something) ; to make inquiries; to refer (to some one for something) ; to apply to (some one) for information

content.content: 試験のことを幹事に問い合わせた
I inquired of the manager about the examination.
学校で問い合わせた
I inquired at the school.
電話で問い合わせた
I inquired by telephone.
人の安否を問い合わせる
to inquire after one
店へ品物を問い合わせる
to inquire at a shop for an article
御問い合わせの品は目下品切れに御座候
The article you inquire for is out of stock.
問い合わせてお知らせ致します
I will let you know after making inquiries.
問い合わせたけれども何の回答も無い
I have heard nothing in reply to my inquiry.
方方へ問い合わせたけれどもわからない
I have made inquiries in various quarters, but in vain.
問い合わせた結果その説は事実無根と判明した
On inquiry, the report proved to be unfounded.
その男の身上に関しては前主人に問い合わせてみよう
I shall refer to his former employer for the man's character.
私の一身に関することは先主人へお問い合わせを願います
Please refer to my former employer for my character―I refer you to my former employer for my character.
なお詳しいことは幹事にお問い合わせ下さい
For further particulars, I refer you to my secretary.
問い合わせ先
a reference
当局者に問い合わせ中
We have applied to the authorities for information.

content:
という〔と言う〕
〈形〉Named; called:(前置調に用いれば)in (the shape of) ; in (the person of)

content.content: 田中という人
a man named Tanaka
チリという国
a country called Chili
島人は茶タバコなどというぜいたく品を要する
The islanders want some luxuries in the shape of tea, tobacco, and the like.
彼には三井という後楯がある
He has a supporter in (the person of) the Mitsuis.
彼はこれぞという著述は無い
He has no literary work worth mentioning―no work to speak of.
彼は財産というほどのものは無い
He has no property worth mentioning―no property to speak of.
家は好い家だが庭というほどの庭が無い
The house is a good one, but there is no garden worth mentioning―no garden to speak of.

content:
といえば〔と言えば〕
〈副〉Talking of (something)

content.content: 馬と言えば僕の今度買った馬を見たか
Talking of horses, have you seen the one I have bought?

content:
といかける〔問い掛ける〕
〈自動〉To put a question to (one)

content.content: たたみかけて問い掛けた
I followed up my question with another.

content:
といき〔吐息〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ためいき〔溜息〕

content:
といし〔砥石〕
〈名〉A whetstone; a grindstone

content.content: 砥石で小刀を研ぐ
to whet a knife―grind a knife

content:
といた〔戸板〕
〈名〉A door or a shutter (used as a stretcher)

content.content: けが人は戸板で担がれて行った
The injured man was carried home on a shutter.

content:
といただす〔問い質す〕
〈他動〉To inquire (of one about something) ; to question (one about something)

content.content: 根掘り葉掘り問い質された
I was subjected to a searching inquiry.

どいつ〔何奴〕
〈疑問代名詞〉Which one?

content:
どいつ〔独逸<ドイツ>〕
〈固名〉Germany:(=の) German

content.content: ドイツ人
a German
ドイツ語
(the) German (language)
「水」のことをドイツ語で何と言うか
What is the German for “water”?
ドイツ帝国
the German Empire
ドイツ共和国
the German Republic
ドイツ系米国人
German-Americans―hyphenated Americans.

content:
どいつ〔独逸<ドイツ>〕
〈固名〉Germany:(=の) German

content.content: ドイツ人
a German
ドイツ語
(the) German (language)
「水」のことをドイツ語で何と言うか
What is the German for “water”?
ドイツ帝国
the German Empire
ドイツ共和国
the German Republic
ドイツ系米国人
German-Americans―hyphenated Americans.

content:
といつめる〔問い詰める〕
〈自動〉To press a question home; to drive a question home; to press (one) for an answer

content.content: 問いつめられて返答に窮した
Pressed for an answer, I was at a loss how to reply.

どいつもこいつも〔何奴も此奴も〕
〈不定代名詞〉Every one of you ［them］

content:
といまる〔問丸〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: といや〔問屋〕

content:
といや〔問屋〕
〈名〉A wholesale merchant; a wholesale dealer; a wholesale store; a wholesale firm; a wholesale house; a commission merchant; a commission agent; a factor

content.content: 穀物問屋
a corn factor
青物問屋
a wholesale green-grocer
問屋をする
to carry on a wholesale trade
問屋営業
wholesale trade―wholesale business―commission business―commission agency―factorship
彼は病の問屋だ
He is a storehouse of diseases.
ドッコイそう安くは問屋で卸さぬ
“Not so fast!”―“There are two words to that bargain.”

content:
とう〔党〕
〈名〉A party; a faction; a combination; a junto; a clique; a coterie

content.content: 党を組む
to form a party
党に加入する
to join a party
党を脱する
to secede from a party
党中党を立つ
to form a party within a party
党員
a member of the party―a partisan
我が党の士だ
He is one of us.
我が党へ引き入れる
to win one over to one's views

content:
とう〔刀〕
〈名〉A sword

content.content: 刀を帯びる
to wear a sword―(は常に、取ってなら)―gird on a sword
刀を売って牛を買う
to give up the sword for the plough―turn one's sword into a ploughshare
一刀の下に斬り棄てた
He cut him down with one stroke of his sword.

content:
とう〔塔〕
〈名〉A tower:(寺のは) a pagoda:(教会堂のは) a steeple:(記念のは) a monument

content.content: 塔を建てる
to build a tower―erect a monument
五重の塔
a five-storied pagoda

content:
とう〔灯〕
〈名〉A light

content.content: (電灯など)十灯
ten lights
日中灯をとぼす(無駄なことをする)
to burn daylight

content:
とう〔当〕
〈名〉(=正当、適当) right; justice; fairness; propriety

content.content: 当を得る
to be right―just―fair―proper
当を得ぬ、当を失する
to be wrong―unjust―unfair―improper
当を得た処置である
It is a just measure.
処置当を得ず
The measure is unjust.
東洋の英国の名は当を得ている
Japan is rightly called―properly named―“the England of the East.”
普選の法案は最も当を得たものであった
The bill for universal suffrage was right and proper.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=めざすところの) the right

content.content: これは捜す当の本人だ
This is the right man.
これは当の本人ではない
You have brought the wrong man.
当の敵はいない
The enemy is gone.

content: 2. (=この) this; the present; the current

content.content: 当家
this house
当著作者(自分)
the present writer
当役所
this office―the present office
当月
this month―the current month
当年
this year―the current year

content: 3. (=その) that; the said

content.content: 当人
the said person―himself
当人はご存じない
He does not know it himself.
当時の学者
the scholars of the day
会費は当日ご持参のこと
You are requested to pay the subscription on the day.

content:
とう〔等〕
〈名〉
1. (=等級) a class; a grade; a degree

content.content: 一等
the first class―the first grade
君汽車は何等に乗るか
What class do you travel?
二等に乗る
I travel second class.
罪一等を減ず
to reduce the penalty by one degree

content: 2. (=など) and the like; and so forth; and so on; and all that; and all the rest of it; and what not; and such-like (things)

content.content: 野球、庭球等の如き競技
baseball, lawn-tennis, and the like―and such-like sports

content:
とう〔糖〕
〈名〉Sugar

content.content: 葡萄糖
grape sugar

content:
とう〔頭〕
〈名〉A head

content.content: 牛一頭、十頭の牛
a head of cattle―ten head of cattle
一頭馬車
a one-horse carriage
二頭立て
a carriage and pair

content:
とう〔訪う〕
〈他動〉To visit (one); to pay a visit to (one); to call on (one); to call at (a house)

content.content: 大臣を官邸に訪う
I called on the Minister at his official residence.

content:
とう〔問う〕
〈他動〉
1. To ask (one's name―one a question―one about something); to inquire (the reason―of one about something); to demand (the reason); to appeal (to the public)

content.content: 巡査がその人の住所姓名を問うた
The policeman asked his name and address.
年齢を問う
to ask one's age
道を問う
to ask the way―inquire (for) the way
時間を問う
to ask the time―ask what the time is
価を問う
to ask the price
その理由を問うた
I inquired the reason―demanded the reason.
人の安否を問う
to ask after a person―inquire after a person
ご商売はご繁昌かと問うた
I asked after his business.
ご病気はいかがですかと問うた
I inquired after his health.
何用かと問うた
I asked what he wanted.
何用かと問われて用は無いと言った
Asked what I wanted, I said I wanted nothing.
彼は僕にいろいろのことを問うた
He asked me various questions―asked me about various things.
問うはやすく答うるは難し
“A fool may ask more questions than a wise man can answer.”
あの人は人に物を問うことを恥じる
He is ashamed to ask questions―too proud to ask questions―above asking questions.
問うは一時の恥問わぬは一生の恥
“Be not ashamed to ask, and you escape a lifelong shame.”
善いか悪いか心に問うてご覧
Ask yourself whether it is right or wrong.
あえて江湖に問う
I appeal to the public.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 可否を問う
to take the ayes and noes―take the sense of the meeting
是非を問う
to question one's conduct―call one's conduct in question
是非を天下に問わん
Let the public judge between us!
責任を問う、罪を問う
to call one to account
鼎の軽重を問う
to weigh one's ability―call one's ability in question
鼎の軽重を問わる
to have one's ability called in question―be weighed in the balance (and found wanting)
既往は問わず
“Let bygones be bygones.”
問うに落ちず、語るに落ちる
It is easier to draw than to force men.
問われずに言う
to volunteer a statement
他は問わずして可なり
The others are not worth mentioning.
成功失敗は問うところにあらず

I do not care whether I succeed or fail―I do not care about success or failure―It does not matter whether I succeed or fail―Success or failure is of no consequence to me―Success or failure makes no difference to me―Success or failure is indifferent to me.
苦楽は哲人に問うところにあらず
Pleasure or pain is indifferent to the stoic.→『とわず〔問わず〕』

content: 3. (=何罪に問う)to accuse (one of some crime); to charge (one with some crime); to try, arraign, indict (one for some crime―one on a charge of some crime)

content.content: 彼は国事犯に問われた
He was accused of high treason―charged with high treason―tried for high treason―tried on a charge of high treason.
死罪に問われる
to be tried for one's life

content:
とう〔籐〕
〈名〉The cane; the rattan

content.content: 籐椅子
a cane-chair
籐細工
cane-work―rattan-work
この籃{かご}は籐で編んである
The basket is woven of rattan―made of rattan.

content:
とう〔薹〕
〈名〉The flowering-stalk (of a radish, a carrot, etc.)

content.content: 薹が立つ
to run to seed

content:
どう〔何う〕
〈疑問詞〉
1. How?; What?

content.content: どうしましょう
What shall I do?
どう思うか
What do you think?
(病人に向かって)どうです
How do you find yourself?
(近頃は)どうか
How are you (getting along)?―How goes it with you?
身体はどうか
How about your health?
この本はどうか
What do you think of this book?
散歩はどうか
What do you say to a walk?
今度の女中はどうですか(お気に入りましたか)
How do you like your new maid-servant?
今度の先生はどうかね
How do you like the new man for a teacher?
どうでした
How did you find it?―How did you fare?―Well?
花はどうでした
How were the blossoms?
君もやってみたらどうか
What do you say to trying yourself?―Suppose you try.
僕がやってみてはどうでしょう
What do you think of my trying?―What do you say to my trying?
今度の先生に作文を教えさしてみてはどうだろう
What do you think of―What do you say to―trying the new man at composition?
どうだってかまやせぬ
I don't care how it is.
うぬ、どうしてくれよう
Wretch! What shall I do with you?
人はどう言おうとかまわぬ
I don't care what others may say.
人はどう言おうとも僕はするだけのことをする
Whatever others may say, I will do my duty.
これは英語でどう言うか
How do you put it in English?
「流石」という事を英語でどう言うか
What is the English for “sasuga”?
先生生徒の気受はどうか
How does he get on with the students?
他の先生との折合はどうか
How does he get on with the other teachers?
麻布へはどう参りますか
How can I get to Azabu?―Which road shall I take to get to Azabu?
君のやり方はどうか
How do you go about it?―How do you proceed?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: それはどうだか
I am not so sure of that.
彼はどうほめても正直とばかりは言えぬ
He is anything but honest.
彼はどう評しても豪傑とばかりは言えぬ
He is anything but a hero.
どうあっても〔何うあっても〕
どういう〔何ういう〕
どういうものか〔何ういうものか〕
どういうわけか〔何ういう訳か〕
どういたしまして〔何う致しまして〕
どうおもったか〔何う思ったか〕
どうか〔何うか〕
どうかこうか〔何うか斯うか〕
どうかして〔何うかして〕
どうかする〔何うかする〕
どうかすると〔何うかすると〕
どうかなる〔何うか成る〕
どうかんがえても〔何う考えても〕
どうした〔何うした〕
どうしたって〔何うしたって〕
どうして〔何うして〕
どうしてどうして〔何うして何うして〕
どうしても〔何うしても〕
どうする〔何うする〕
どうぞ〔何卒〕

content:
どうい〔同意〕
〈名〉Agreement; concurrence; consent; assent:(=する) to agree (with a person―about a matter―on a point); to concur (with a person in his views); to fall in with (one's views); to subscribe to (one's views); to endorse (one's views); to be of the same opinion (as one); to be (all) of a mind; to consent (to a plan); to assent (to a plan)

content.content: 僕も君と同意だ
I agree with you―I concur with you in your views―I am of the same opinion as you―I am of your opinion―I am of your mind.
その点は僕も同意だ
I agree with you on that point―I am at one with you on that point.
君と同意することができぬ
I can not agree with you―endorse your views―subscribe to your views―I must disagree with you―differ with you.
皆同意か
Are you all of a mind?
我々も皆同意だ
And so say all of us.
この点については僕も Plato の意見に同意する
On this point, I fall in with Plato's views.
僕も Plato と同意で霊魂は不滅だと思う
I hold with Plato that the soul is immortal.
僕はキリスト教徒と同意で来世の有ることを信ずる
I believe with the Christians that there is a life after death.
同意を表わす
to express one's concurrence (in an opinion)
皆同意を表わして手を挙げた
They showed their hands in expression of their concurrence.
同意を得る
to obtain one's consent
校長の同意を得てこの計画を起こしたのだ
I set the project on foot with my principal's consent.
同意者
an assentient

content:
どういう〔何ういう〕
〈疑問形容詞〉What kind of...?; What sort of...?

content.content: どういう本が読みたいのか
What kind of books do you wish to read?
どういう人が欲しいのか
What sort of a man do you want?
ここはどういう意味か
What is the meaning of this passage?
この金はどういう金か
How did you come by this money?
どういうわけか
What is the reason?―How is that?
君はいつも払いが後れるのはどういうわけか
How is it that―How comes it that―How happens it that―you are always behind time with your payment?
物が地に落ちるのはどういうわけか
How is it that things fall to the earth?
君はどういうわけで辞職するのか
How is it that you wish to resign?―What is your reason for wishing to resign?
どういうわけかそのわけが聞きたい
I want to know the reason why.

content:

content.content: あの人は勉強はするがどういうものか成功しない
He does work hard, but somehow he never succeeds in anything.
僕はどういうものかあの人が好かん
I know not how it is, but―Somehow or other―I have no liking for that man.
どういうものか運が向かぬ
I know not how it is, but―Somehow―luck goes against me.
僕はいくら努めてもどういうものか彼が満足しない
I try ever so hard, but somehow I can not satisfy him.

〈名〉

content.content: 支那は南北に分かれて統一を欠いている

content:
どうかこうか〔何うか斯うか〕
〈副〉Somehow or other; one way or another; by some means or other; by fair means or foul; by hook or by crook; as best one may; anyhow ［注意］これに代用する動詞三あり。

content.content: どうかこうか食っている
He manages to live―contrives to live―makes shift to live.
どうかこうか暮らして行く
He gets along somehow or other―He scratches along.
どうかこうか露命をつないでいる
He manages (somehow or other) to keep body and soul together.
どうかこうか借金だけはせずに
I manage (somehow or other) to keep out of debt.
僕にどうかこうかできそうだ
I think I can manage to do it.
彼はどうかこうか目的をとげる
He will accomplish his purpose by some means or other―by fair means or foul.
七所借りしてどうかこうか金をまとめた
I managed by hook or by crook to scrape together the required sum.
寡婦がどうかこうか子どもを教育した
The widow educated her children as best she might.
どうかこうかこぎつけた
I have struggled through somehow.
彼はどうかこうかこぎつけた
He struggled through anyhow.
やりにくいことをどうかこうかごまかす
to manage a delicate matter
彼はどうかこうか試験だけは通過する
He scrapes through his examinations.
どうかこうか後へついて行った
I stumbled after him as best I might.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は誰とでもどうかこうか近づきになる
He scrapes acquaintance with everybody.
どうかこうか間に合わせて行く
I can make both ends meet.
どうかこうかその日を送っている
He rubs through life―scratches along.

どうかして入り込む、どうかして出る
to find one's way in―find one's way out
彼はどうかして米国へ行った
He found his way to America.

content: 2. (If) possibly (can)

content.content: どうかしてできるならやってみよう
I will try if I possibly can.

content:
どうかする〔何うかする〕
〈他動〉
1. (=処置する)to dispose of, see to, see about (a person or thing)

content.content: まずできた子をどうかしなけりゃならぬ
The born child must first be disposed of.
今夜はここへ泊まるから、夜具をどうかしてくれ
I shall stay here overnight, so please see about my bedding.
どうかしておこう
I'll see to it―see about it.
どうかさせておこう
I will have it seen to.

content: 2. (=計らう)to manage (somehow)

content.content: 金のことは僕がどうかしよう
As for the money, I will manage it somehow.

content: 3. (=何か故障がある)something is the matter with, something is wrong with (a person or thing)

content.content: 君は青い顔をしている、どうかしたか
You look sallow. Is anything the matter with you?
どうかしたに違いない
Something must be the matter with you.
この時計がどうかした
Something is the matter with this clock―Something is wrong with this clock―Something has gone wrong with this clock.

content:
どうかすると〔何うかすると〕
〈副〉
1. (=何かの方法で)in some way

content.content: この蓋がどうかすると取れるのだが忘れた

content: 2. (=時とすると)at times

content.content: この子はどうかするとはしゃぎ出す
The child will have a merry fit at times.

content: 3. (=とかく)(to be) apt (to do something)

content.content: あの人はどうかすると腹をたてる
He is apt to take offence.
どうかするとその誤りに陥る人がある
Some people are apt to fall into that error.

for the time (being)―for a time

content.content: 皆人間同士だ

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 二人はかたき同士だ
They are rivals―enemies.
好いた同士だ、思う同士だ
They are lovers.
好いた同士の縁
a love-match
従兄弟同士だ

従兄弟同士の夫婦だ
They are a consanguineous couple.
内輪同士だ

他人同士だ
They are strangers.
隣り同士だから仲好くしよう
Since we are next-door neighbours, we ought to be on good terms with each other.
男同士で惚れ合った

女同士で心中した

content:
どうじ〔同時〕
〈名〉The same time:(同時なること) simultaneity; synchronism:(=に) at the same time; at once; simultaneously; synchronously:(接続詞に用いれば)while:(=の) simultaneous, synchronous (occurrence, etc.)

content.content: 同時に起きる
to occur at the same time―synchoronize

to begin with―end with―something

content:
どうした〔何うした〕
〈疑問副詞〉
1. How?; What?

content.content: これはどうしたものだ
How is this?
彼は何をしても成功しないのはどうしたものだ
How is it that he never succeeds in anything?
今日はこう病人の多いのはどうしたものだ
How is it that so many are on the sick-list today?
これはどうした金だ
How did you come by this money?
はて、どうしたものだろう
I wonder what I ought to do.

content:
2. 
〈感嘆形容詞〉 What...!

content.content: あんな者を信用するとはどうしたばかだ
What a fool you are to trust such a man!
それはどうしたありさまだ
What a state you are in!―What a plight you are in!

content:
3. 
〈不定形容詞〉 (…か) some

content.content: どうしたわけか彼は来ない
He has not turned up somehow―for some reason.
彼はどうしたはずみか失敗した
He failed by some chance.

content:
どうじだい〔同時代〕
〈名〉The same age; the same period:(=の) contemporary (with a person); contemporaneous (with a thing)

a contemporary of Shakespeare's

どうしたって〔何うしたって〕
〈副〉→『

content:
とうじつ〔当日〕
〈名〉The day (appointed or predicted)

content.content: 当日雨天の節は順延のこと
If it rains on the appointed day, it will be postponed till the first fine day.
右規則は発布当日より施行す
The above regulations shall come into force on the day of their issue.

content:
どうしつ〔同室〕
〈名〉The same room:(=する) to occupy the same room, share a room, chum (with some one)

content.content: 同室者
a chum

to chum A on B

content:
どうじつ〔同日〕
〈名〉The same day

content.content: 同日の論にあらず
They are not to be named on the same day―The one is not to be mentioned in the same breath with the other.

content:
どうして〔何うして〕
〈疑問副詞〉How?; Why?

content.content: どうして来たか
How did you come?
どうして来なかったか
Why did you not come?
どうしてそんなことを言うのか
Why do you say such a thing?
君はどうしてあの人を知っているか
How came you to know him?
君はどうしてここにいるのか
How came you to be here?
お前はどうして叱られたか
How did you get into trouble?
彼は独探だということがどうして君にわかったか
How did you know him for a German spy?
彼はどうしてあんな者を貰ったのかしら
I wonder how he can have married such a woman.
どうして飯を食っているか
How do you live?―How do you get your living?
彼はどうしてその日を送っているか
How does he get his living?―How does he earn his bread?
後にのこれる妻や子は
My wife and little ones I leave behind―
どうしてその日を送るやら
How shall they their means of living find?
そればかりの給料でどうし暮らして行けるか
How do you manage to get along on such scanty pay?
どうして彼の帰りが遅いかしら
What can be keeping him?

content: 〈強声打消〉(Emphatic) no

content.content: どうして、まだまだできない
Oh no! it is not nearly finished.
どうして、今始めたばかりだ
Why, I have only just begun.
どうして彼がそんなことをするものか
Not he!
どうして、一日や二日ではとてもできん
Never! it can never be done in a day or two.
一人じゃどうして、三人掛りでもむつかしい
One man can never do it; three men can hardly do it.

content:
どうしてどうして〔何うして何うして〕
〈応答詞〉(Emphatic) no

content.content: 彼が金を出すかって、どうしてどうして
He give money? Not he!―Far from it―No such thing―Nothing of the kind.

content:
どうしても〔何うしても〕
〈不定副詞〉
1. (=どのようにしても)Whatever one may do; do what one will; however hard one may try; ever so hard; to do one's best; to do one's utmost; for the life of me

content.content: どうしてもこの問題ができない
Do what I will,―Try ever so hard,―To do my utmost,―I can not solve this problem.
この子はどうしても言うことを聴きません
Do what I may, the child will not obey me.
おどしてもすかしてもどうしても言うことを聴かない
Neither threats nor entreaties can make him obey me―Nothing can make him obey me.
どうしてもその名が思い出せない
I can not, for the life of me, recollect his name―I can not, to save my life, recollect his name.
どうしても君にゃかなわない
I am no match for you―not a patch upon you.

content: 2. (=どんなことをしても)at any cost; at all costs; at all risks; at all hazards; by fair means or foul; by hook or by crook

content.content: どうしても目的を遂行する決心だ
I am determined to accomplish my purpose at any cost―at all costs.
どうしても行く(のだから止めるな)
I will go at all hazards―at all risks.
どうしてもこの地位を手に入れたい
I must secure the position by fair means or foul―by hook or by crook.
どうしても(たとい火刑になっても)これを主張する
I would assert it at stake.

content: 3. (=どんなことがあっても)on no account; never

content.content: この秘密はどうしても言われない
On no account can I disclose the secret―I will never tell.
この品ばかりはどうしても手放されない
I can not part with the article on any account―I will never part with it.

content: 4. (=何を貰っても)(I would not) for the world

content.content: 恩人を害することはどうしてもいやだ
I would not injure my benefactor for the world―Nothing can induce me to injure my benefactor.

content: 5. (=いくら出しても)(not to be had) for love or money

content.content: しけで魚がどうしても無い
Owing to stress of weather, no fish is to be had for love or money.

content: 6. (=どう考えても)surely (must, can not)

content.content: どうしても嘘に違いない
Surely it must be false.
どうしても本当なはずが無い
Surely it can not be true.

content: 7. (=是非)(must) needs

content.content: この金がどうしても無ければならない
I must needs have this money―I need the money badly.
(二人意見を異にする時は)一人はどうしても間違っているに違いない
When two men differ in opinion, one of them must be in the wrong.

content: 8. (=とても)(can not) possibly

content.content: その計画にはどうしても賛成ができぬ
I can not possibly approve of your plan.
そんなことはどうしても成功するはずが無い
It cannot possibly succeed.
彼はどうしても勝てぬ
He can not possibly win.
これはどうしても駄目だ
It is a sheer impossibility―quite impossible―no go.
君にはどうしても叶わぬ
I am not nearly a match for you―I am not a patch upon you.

content: 9. (=結局)in the end; after all

content.content: どうしても実力が勝つ
Real ability will win in the end―Real ability wins in the long run―Ability wins after all.

content: 10. (=とにかく)in any case; anyhow

content.content: どうしても百円はかかる
It will cost 100 yen, anyhow.

content: 11. (=どうかこうか)somehow or other

content.content: どうしても暮らせるじゃないか
Why, you can manage somehow or other to live.

content:
12. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの人にはどうしても(生まれ変らなけりゃ)嘘が吐けない
He is incapable of telling a lie―It is not in him to tell a lie.
どうしても僕にできそうだ
I feel within me―I feel it in my bones―that I can do it.
どうしてもご相談に応ずる気になれぬ
I can not bring myself to accept your offer.
彼が罪人とはどうしても信じられぬ
I can not persuade myself of his guilt.
あの二人はどうしても夫婦としか見えぬ
They are, to all appearance, man and wife.
この計画はどうしても失敗としか思えぬ
The project is, in all probability, a failure.
風邪を引いてどうしても治らぬ
I can not get over my cold.
僕にはどうしても数学が好きになれぬ
I can't get to like mathematics.
彼を無くなしたのばかりはどうしても諦められぬ
I can not get over his loss.
この上衣はどうしても着られぬ
I can not get this coat on―get into this coat.
どうしても入れなかった
I could not get in.
どうしても出られなかった
I could not get out.
この薪はどうしても燃えない
This wood will not burn―refuses to burn.
この抽斗はどうしてもあかない
This drawer will not open―refuses to open.
この徳利の口がどうしても抜けない
This cork will not come out―refuses to come out.

content:

content.content: おとなもその後に瞠若たり
He makes an adult stare in wonder.

とうしゃばん〔謄写版〕

to play in the (pitcher's) box

content.content: 公爵家の当主
the present prince

content.content: 五年級がストライキをやると全校が踏襲した
When the Fifth Year struck, the rest followed suit.

とうしゅくする〔投宿する〕

content.content: 彼は上京すると帝国ホテルに投宿する
When he comes to town, he puts up at the Imperial―registers at the Imperial.

どうしゅくする〔同宿する〕

どうしゅくにん〔同宿人〕
〈名〉A fellow-lodger; a fellow-guest

とうじゅす〔唐繻子〕
〈名〉Silk satin

content:
とうしょ〔投書〕
〈名〉A contribution:(=する) to contribute an article to (a periodical)

content.content: 投書を歓迎す
Contributions are cordially invited.
投書は匿名だと没書になる
Anonymous contributions are rejected.
投書家
a contributor
投書欄
the contributor's column
投書函
a box for contributions

content:
とうしょ〔当初〕
〈名〉The beginning:(副詞に用いれば)in the beginning; at first:(=の) first; original; initial

content.content: 当初の目的を没却する
to lose sight of the original object

とうしょ〔当所〕
〈名〉This place (this town, this city, this village, this office, etc.)

とうしょ〔頭書〕
〈名〉A superscription:(=する) to superscribe

どうじょ〔童女〕
〈名〉A young girl

content:

〈名〉Frost-bite; chilblain:(=する) to be frost-bitten

content.content: 足を凍傷する
to get one's feet frost-bitten

とうしょう〔湯傷〕
〈名〉Scald:(=する) to be scalded; to get scalded; to scald oneself

content:
とうじょう〔登場〕
〈名〉Entrance on the stage:(=する) to enter the stage; to appear on the stage; to appear before the footlights

content.content: (演劇指図)ハムレット登場
Enter Hamlet

とうじょう〔搭乗〕
〈名〉Going on board:(=する) to go on board (a ship) ; to get into, board (a train)

どうじょう〔同上〕

content:
どうじょう〔同乗〕
〈名〉Riding together:(=する) to ride together

content.content: 誰と同乗する
to ride with some one in the same carriage

content:
どうじょう〔同情〕
〈名〉Sympathy; compassion; fellow-feeling:(=する) to sympathize with, feel for, compassionate (a person); to wish (one) well

content.content: 同情を寄せる
to sympathize with―feel sympathy for―a person
同情を求める
to enlist one's sympathy
彼は自分の不幸を並べて僕の同情を求めた
He recounted his misfortunes to enlist my sympathy.
同情に訴える
to appeal to one's sympathy
彼は同情が溢れている
He is overflowing with sympathy.
同情の涙を流す
to shed tears of sympathy
世間の同情を得る
to win public sympathy
彼は不幸に逢って世間の同情を得た
His misfortune won him public sympathy.
世間の同情を失う
to lose public sympathy
彼は強情なために世間の同情を失った
His obstinacy lost him public sympathy.
同情を表わす
to show one's sympathy―express one's sympathy―(for one's misfortune)
ご同情を謝す
I am grateful to you for your sympathy.
一片の同情あらばこの不幸な人々を助けよ
If you have a particle of sympathy for these unfortunate men, help them.
同情を得る
to win one's sympathy
彼は同情心がある
He is of a sympathetic temperament.
僕は同情を起こした
I was moved to sympathy―I felt compassionate.
皆僕に同情して差控えた
They all desisted out of sympathy with me.
ご同情申上げます
I sympathize with you―Please accept my sympathy.
同情者
a sympathizer―(事業などに対してなら)―a well-wisher

content:
どうじょう〔道場〕
〈名〉(The former name for) a school

content.content: 劔術の道場
a fencing-hall―a fencing-school
荒木又右衛門が大阪に剣術の道場を開いていたことがある
Araki Mataemon once kept a fencing-school in Osaka.

content:
とうじょうか〔筒状花〕
〈名〉A tubular flower

content.content: 筒状花冠
tubular corolla

とうじょうか〔頭状花〕
〈名〉A capitate flower

どうじょうしゃ〔同情者〕
〈名〉A sympathizer; a well-wisher (to the enterprise, etc.)

とうじょうじんぶつ〔登場人物〕
〈名〉Dramatis personae

どうじょうまわり〔道場廻り〕
〈名〉Making the round of fencing-schools:(=する) to make the round of fencing-schools (to try one's skill)

どうじょうやぶり〔道場破り〕
〈名〉(事)breaking a fencing-school:(人)a fencing-school breaker:(=する) to break a fencing-school (by beating its master and demolishing the signboard)

content:
どうしょくぶつ〔動植物〕
〈名〉Plants and animals:(一地方、一時代の動植物)fauna and flora

content.content: 動植物の標本を集める
to collect the specimens of plants and animals

content:
どうじる〔動じる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: どうずる〔動ずる〕

とうしん〔刀身〕

content:
とうしん〔投身〕
〈名〉Suicide by drowning:(=する) to commit suicide by drowning; to drown oneself (in a river)

content.content: 投身者
a suicide

content:
とうしん〔盗心〕
〈名〉Propensity to theft; a thieving propensity

content.content: 盗心狂
kleptomania
あの男は盗心狂だ
He is a kleptomaniac.

content:
とうしん〔灯心〕
〈名〉A wick; a lamp-wick

content.content: 灯心草
the rush
灯心蝋燭
a rush-candle―a rushlight

content:
とうしん〔等親〕
〈名〉Degrees of relationship

content.content: 一等親、二等親
a relation of the first degree―a relation of the second degree

content:
とうしん〔等身〕
〈名〉Life size:(=の) life-size; as large as life

content.content: 肖像は等身大
The portrait is as large as life―life-size.
等身像
a life-size statue

content:
とうじん〔唐人〕
〈名〉(本当は支那人)a Chinese:(普通は西洋人)a foreigner

content.content: 唐人の寝言
gibberish―jargon
あの人の言うことは唐人の寝言だ
He talks jargon―What he says is Greek to me.

content:
とうじん〔蕩尽〕
〈名〉Squandering:(=する) to squander, go through (one's fortune)

content.content: 彼は財産を蕩尽した
He has gone through his fortune―squandered his fortune―made ducks and drakes of his money.

どうしん〔同心〕
〈名〉A police constable (under the Tokugawa regime)

どうしん〔道心〕
〈名〉
1. (=道徳心)moral sense; moral sentiment
2. (=信念)piety
3. (=僧侶)a priest

どうじん〔同人〕
〈名〉A companion; a comrade; an associate

content:
どうじん〔同仁〕
〈名〉Universal love

content.content: 一視同仁
universal brotherhood

どうしんえん〔同心円〕
〈名〉Concentric circles
どうしんきょうりょく

どうしんきょうりょく〔同心協力〕
〈名〉Harmonious cooperation:(=する) to cooperate in harmony; to unite their efforts with one accord

content:
とうすい〔統帥〕
〈名〉Supreme command

content.content: 天皇は陸海軍を統帥する
The Emperor has the supreme command of the army and navy.
統帥権
the Imperial prerogative of supreme command

どうすいあつりょく〔動水圧力〕
〈名〉Hydraulic pressure

どうすいがく〔動水学〕
〈名〉Hydraulics; hydrodynamics

content:
どうすう〔同数〕
〈名〉The same number; as many

content.content: 可否同数なる時は議長に裁決権あり
When the votes are equally divided, the president has the casting vote.

とうする〔党する〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=組する)to side with (one)
2. (=おもねる)to flatter (one)
3. (=ぐるになる)to conspire with (one)
4. (=偏する)to be biassed (in favour of a party)

content:
とうずる〔投ずる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=投げる、投げ入れる、投げ捨てる)to throw; to throw in; to throw away; to give up; to cast

content.content: 汽車に石を投ずる
to throw stones at a running train
彼は海に投じて死んだ
He threw himself into the sea―drowned himself in the sea.
獄に投ずる
to cast one into prison―put one in prison
火中に投ずる
to throw anything into the fire―commit anything to the flames
この手紙を読み次第に火中に投ぜよ
As soon as you have read this letter, commit it to the flames.
彼は剣を投じて文筆を事とした
He give up the sword for the pen.

content: 2. (=身を投ずる)to plunge into, launch into (politics); to embark in, launch forth in (an enterprise); to venture on (a speculation); to devote oneself to, commit oneself to (some cause); to join, cast in one's lot with (a party); to desert to, go over to (the enemy)

content.content: 校長は火中に身を投じて御真影を取出した
The principal plunged into the fire, and rescued the Imperial portrait.
政界に身を投ずる
to plunge into politics―launch into politics―go into politics
事業に身を投ずる
to embark in an enterprise―launch forth in an enterprise
投機事業に身を投ずる
to venture on a speculation
教育に一身を投ずる
to devote oneself to―commit oneself to―the cause of education
政党に投ずる
to join a political party―cast in one's lot with a party
彼は財産を使い果たして社会党に投じた
He went through his fortune, and joined the socialists.
不平を起こして敵に投じた
He laboured under a sense of wrong, and went over to the enemy―deserted to the enemy.
山賊に投ずる
to join the bandits―take to the road
そうすれば日本は戦争の渦中に投ぜざるを得ぬ
Then Japan will be embroiled in a war.
思い切って一身を投ずる
to take the plunge

content: 3. (=資を投ずる)to invest, sink, lay out (capital in anything); to spend, expend (money on anything); to give (so much for something)

content.content: 事業に資本を投ずる
to invest capital in―sink one's capital in―lay out money in―an enterprise
彼は鉱山に資本を投じている
He has sunk his capital in mines.
全財産を挙げて一事業に投ずるは愚である
It is foolish to invest one's all in a single enterprise―risk one's all on a single venture―“put all one's eggs in one basket.”
公共事業に私財を投ずる
to expend private funds on a public enterprise
彼は私財を投じて治水工事をした
He undertook river-improvement works at his own expense.
これは彼が大金を投じて建てた家だ
The house was built at a great cost.
十万円を投じて建てた家だ
The house was built at a cost of 100,000 yen.
大金を投じて買った家だ
He gave a large sum for the house.
十万円を投じて買った家だ
He gave 100,000 yen for the house.

content: 4. (=機に投ずる) opportune; seasonable; timely; well-timed

content.content: これは機に投じたる策と言うべし
It mush be pronounced an opportune scheme―a timely project.

content: 5. (=人気に投ずる)to catch popularity; to catch on; to take; to hit (the taste)

content.content: その小説は人気に投じてたいそう売れた
The novel caught on, and sold immensely.
計略が人気に投じてその男は大金を儲けた
The stratagem took, and the man made a fortune.
その演劇は世人の嗜好に投じた
The play hit the taste of the public―hit the popular fancy.
人気に投ずる策だ
The scheme is a claptrap.
人気に投ずる小説だ
It is a sensational novel.
これは人気に投ずる話題だ
This is a taking topic.

content: 6. (=投合する)to agree with (one's temper); to coincide with (one's views); to hit with, jump with (one's humour); to fall in with, strike in with (one's views)

content.content: その計画は彼の意気に投じた
The scheme hit with his humour―jumped with his humour―fell in with his views―struck in with his views.
この策が世人の意気に投じた
The scheme hit with the popular humour―jumped with the popular wishes.
二人は意気相い投じている
They are congenial spirits.

content:
どうする〔何うする〕
〈自他動〉
1. What to do; how to act

content.content: 君どうする
What will you do?―What are you going to do?
君が僕と位置を換えたらどうする
What would you do (if you were) in my place?
万一病気にでもなったらどうする(たいへんだ)
What if you should fall ill?
どうしよう
What shall I do?
どうしてよいやら
I don't know what to do―I am at a loss how to act―I am at my wits' end―I am perplexed.
どうすればよいのか、どうしろというのか
What do you wish me to do?―What would you have me do?
どうすることもできない
I can do nothing―I am helpless.
君がいないとどうすることもできない
We can do nothing without you―We can not do without you.

content: 2. (=何をどうする)what to do with, how to dispose of (something)

content.content: あの金をどうしたか
What have you done with the money?―How have you disposed of the money?
君時計をどうした
What have you done with your watch?
この子を(棄てようか)どうしようか
What shall I do with this child?
彼はあれほどの身代をどうしたか
What has he done with all his fortune?
ご子息はどうなさるおつもりですか
What are you going to do with your son?―What are your intentions regarding your son?

content: 3. (=どうなる)what becomes of (him)?

content.content: 田中が少しも見えないが、どうしたかしら
I have seen nothing of Tanaka. I wonder what can have become of him.

content: 4. (=どうするため)what (anything) is for

content.content: あの孔はどうする孔か
What is the hole for?
あの窓はどうする窓か
What is that window for?
(人に異状あるを見て)君どうしたか
What is the matter with you?―What is wrong with you?―What has gone wrong with you?―What has come over you?
どうかしたか
Is (there) anything the matter with you?―Is (there) anything wrong with you?
どうもせぬ
Nothing is the matter with me―Nothing is wrong with me―I am all right.
(人の過失などを見て)どうしたのか
How did it happen?
そんなことで(いったい)どうする
What (on earth) is all this?
そんな弱いことでどうする
What is all this weakness?
そんな意気地の無いことでどうする
What is all this shiftlessness?
そんな度胸の無いことでどうする
What is all this pusillanimity?

content:
どうずる〔動ずる〕
〈自動〉To be moved; to be agitated; to be disturbed; to be perturbed

content.content: 彼はその光景を見て少しも動ずる色が無かった
He saw the sight quite unmoved.
彼は何事にも動じない
Nothing can perturb him―He is imperturbable.
どんな危険に逢っても動じない
No danger can disturb his composure.

content:
どうせ〔何うせ〕
〈副〉
1. In any case; anyhow; after all

content.content: どうせ要る金だ
I shall need the money in any case.
どうせ行くのだからいつ行くのも同じことだ
I am going there anyhow, so it makes no difference when I go.
どうせ要る品だから早晩買わなけりゃならないのだ
We shall need it anyway, and must get it some time or other.
どうせしまいには己の厄介になるのだ
They come to me in the end, after all.
どうせそうでしょうよ
I expected that of you, anyhow.

content: 2. (…なら)(if) at all

content.content: どうせやるなら早くやる方がよい
If you give at all, the sooner you do so the better.
どうせ金を出すならきれいに出せ
If you give the money at all, give freely and willingly.
どうせ白状するならきれいに白状してしまえ
If you confess at all, make a clean breast of it.

content:
とうせい〔当世〕
〈名〉The present age; the present day; modern times; this corrupt age; these degenerate days:(=の) present; modern; of the day

content.content: 彼は当世の人だ
He is a man of the modern school.
当世の娘は親の言うことを聴かない
A girl of the day will not marry a husband chosen by her parents.
当世の美人には男のために目を泣きつぶすような者は無い
No beauty of the day will cry herself blind over a lover―“Love is the modern fair one's jest.”
当世ふう
the modern style―the modern school―modernism―the fashion―the mode
当世ふうの
fashionable―modish―stylish
当世ふうの婦人だ
She is a fashionable lady―a lady of fashion.
当世ふうの支度をしている
She is stylishly dressed―in a stylish dress.
彼は当世文学に明るい
He is posted up in current literature.
そのやり方は当世向きだ
That way of proceeding is good enough for this corrupt age.
あの人は当世に向かない
He is too good for these degenerate days.
何でも金に転ぶのが当世だ
It is the fashion now to follow gain.
それが当世だ
That is the fashion.

content:
どうせい〔動静〕
〈名〉Motion and rest; movements; state of things

content.content: 敵の動静をうかがう
to watch the movements of the enemy
人の動静をうかがう
to spy on one's movements
世の動静をうかがう
to observe the state of affairs
政界の動静をうかがう
to watch the development of political affairs

content:
どうせい〔同棲〕
〈名〉Cohabitation:(=する) to cohabit; to live together

content.content: 男女同棲する
A man cohabits with a woman―A man lives together with a woman.

content:
どうぜい〔同勢〕
〈名〉A party (of travellers)

content.content: 同勢を集める
to make up a party
同勢八人
We are a party of eight―There are eight of us.

content:
どうせきする〔同席する〕
〈自動〉To sit in company (with some one); to sit at the same table (with some one)

content.content: 我々共があなたがたと同席するのはもったいない
It is not for us to sit at the same table with you.
彼とはどこかで同席したことがある
I remember meeting him somewhere.

content:
とうせつ〔当節〕
〈副〉In these days; in our days; nowadays

content.content: 当節そんなことをする者は無い
No one will think of doing such a thing in these days.
当節の学生には珍しい勉強家だ
He is a rare hard-worker among students nowadays.
当節は金の世の中だ
Money is everything nowadays.

content:
とうせん〔盗泉〕
〈名〉The robber's fountain

content.content: 渇しても盗泉の水を飲まず
I would rather starve than batten on ill-gotten wealth.

content:
とうせん〔当千〕
〈名〉A match for a thousand

content.content: 一騎当千の勇士
Each of them is equal to ten.

content:
とうせん〔当選〕
〈名〉
1. (=議員の当選)being elected; successful election:(=する) to be elected; to be returned (an M. P.); to win the election; to get in

content.content: 東京市では鳩山氏が衆議院議員に当選した
Mr. Hatoyama was returned an M. P. for Tokyo.
最高点で当選した
He was elected first on the list (of successful candidates).
次点で当選した
He was elected second on the list.
三百票の多数で当選した
He won the election by a majority of 300 votes.
今度は当選するつもりだ
I hope I shall get in this time.
当選を祝す
Allow me to congratulate you on your successful election!
当選者
the successful candidate

content: 2. (=出品の当選)acceptance (of an exhibit):(=する) to be accepted

content.content: 彼の油絵は帝展で当選した
His oil-painting was accepted at the Imperial Exhibition.

content: 3. (=懸賞の当選)winning a prize:(=する) to win a prize

content.content: 一等に当選する
to win the first prize
彼は懸賞小説に当選して千円の懸賞を取った
His novel won him a prize of 1,000 yen.
当選した小説
the prize-novel
当選者
a prize-winner

content:
とうせん〔当籤〕
〈名〉(事)drawing a prize, winning a prize (in a lottery):(物)a prize ticket (in a lottery):(=する) to draw a prize, win a prize (in a lottery)

content.content: 当籤券
the prize ticket
当籤番号
the prize number―the winning number―the lucky number
当籤者
a prize-winner

content:
とうぜん〔東漸〕
〈名〉Moving eastward:(=する) to move eastward

content.content: 文明は東漸す
Civilization spread eastward.

content:
とうぜん〔当然〕
〈形〉(義務として当然)proper; right; just; fair:(当然の結果)natural (consequence):(当然の賞罰)due, merited, deserved (reward or punishment):(当然のこと)(a matter) of course, to be expected:(副詞に用いれば)naturally; in the nature of things; in the nature of the case; as a matter of course

content.content: 借りた物を返すのは当然だ(当然の義務)
It is proper that one should pay what one owes―One ought to pay what one owes.
あの勉強家が成功するのは当然だ(当然の結果)
It is natural that such a diligent man should succeed―It is no wonder that such a hard-working man should succeed―Such a hard-worker ought to succeed.
親が子を養うのは当然だ(当然の義務)
It is proper―but right―but just―that a father should provide for his children―A father ought to provide for his children.
あの怠け者が落第するのは当然だ(当然の結果)
It is natural―no great wonder―that such an idle fellow should fail in his examination―Such an idle fellow ought to fail.
負けた者が入費を負担するのは当然だ(当然の義務)
It is but just―It is only right and proper―It stands to reason―that the loster should bear the expenses―The loser must bear the expenses in the nature of the case.
彼があんなことをしたから絶交するのは当然だ
After such conduct on his part, our intercourse is naturally at an end.
当然そうなるべきことだ
It ought to be so―It should be so as a matter of course―It is a matter of course that it should be so―It is in the nature of things that is should be so.
成功者が名利を得るのは当然だ
It is a matter of course that wealth and fame should follow success―If a man succeeds, wealth and fame will follow as a matter of course.
当然受くべきもの、当然与うべき物(報酬、賞罰)
one's due―one's deserts
当然与うべきものを与える
to give one one's due―give one one's deserts
彼は当然受くべきものを受けたのだ
He has his due―He has got his deserts.
彼は当然受くべき賞を受けたのだ
He has his due.
彼は当然受くべき罰を受けたのだ
He has got his deserts―He has been deservedly dealt with.
彼は賞を受けるのが当然だ(当然の権利)
He ought to be rewarded―He deserves a reward―He is worthy of a reward―He is entitled to a reward―He has a right to a reward.
彼は罰せられるのが当然だ
He ought to be punished―He richly deserves a punishment.
それが当然の罰じゃわい(好い気味だ)
You richly deserve it―It serves you right―Serve you right!
働く者が報酬を受けるのは当然だ(当然の権利)
The labourer deserves his wages―“The labourer is worthy of his hire”―The labourer is entitled to his wages―Labour ought to be rewarded.
働く者に報酬を与えるは当然だ(当然の義務)
It is but just that we should reward labour―Recompense is due to the labourer.
彼を筆頭に置くのが当然だ(当然の権利義務)

The first place is due to him―He is entiled to the first place―He has a right to the first place―He deserves the first place―He is worthy of the first place―We ought to give him the first place―It is proper that we should give him the first place.
君は総領だから跡を取るのが当然だ

You ought to succeed to the property by right of primogeniture―Your right of primogeniture entitles you to succeed to the property―You, as the first-born, has a right to the succession―By rights, you ought to be heir as the first-born.
かえって悦ぶのが当然だ
We ought rather to be glad―We have cause to rejoice―We have cause for joy.
当然のこと
a matter of course
当然の結果
a natural consequence
当然の結果だ
It is a natural consequence―Such a result was to be expected.
当然の義務
one's bounden duty
恩人の子どもを世話するのは当然の義務だ
It is my bounden duty to help my benefactor's son―I am in duty bound to help my benefactor's son.
当然の権利
an undoubted right

content:
とうぜん〔陶然〕
〈副〉Sweetly

content.content: 陶然として酔う
to be gloriously drunk

content:
どうぜん〔同然〕
〈副〉
1. Virtually; practically; in effect; to all intents and purposes; as good as; no better than

content.content: 彼は(生きているとは名ばかりで)死んだも同然だ
He is practically dead―virtually dead―as good as dead―to all intents and purposes, a dead man.
日本海の海戦で日露戦争は事実上すんだも同然であった
At the naval battle of the Japan Sea, the Russo-Japanese War was practically at an end―virtually at an end―as good as over.
彼は眼鏡をはずすと盲目も同然だ
Without his spectacles, he is as good as blind―practically blind.
彼は乞食も同然だ
He is no better than a beggar―practically a beggar.
この株券は反古も同然だ
These shares are no better than waste-paper.
この回答は事実上謝罪も同然だ
The answer is, in effect, an apology.
そんな金はどぶへ捨てたも同然だ
The money is as good as thrown away―It is a sheer waste of the money.
十分に頂戴すれば二の膳も同然
“Enough is as good as a feast.”
二人は夫婦も同然
They are practically man and wife.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 目はあっても節孔同然
He can not read.
金は貴方に預けておけば銀行に預けたも同然です
The money is safe in your hands.
お志でたくさん、もう頂戴したも同然です
I will take the will for the deed.
ただ貰ったも同然
The price is nominal.
袋の鼠も同然
He is a mouse in a trap.

content: 2. Might as well...as...; no more...than...

content.content: あのような人を害そうとするのは太陽に石を投げるも同然だ
You might as well throw a stone at the sun as try to injure such a man.
彼に勧めるのは狼に説諭するのも同然だ
You might as well reason with the wolf as try to persuade him.
鯨を魚というなら牛馬を指して魚だというも同然だ
You might as well call a horse a fish as call a whale a fish―The whale is no more a fish than a horse is.
彼は我々も同然神様でも何でもない
He is no more a god than we are.
彼は我々も同然口を出す権利が無い
He has no more right to interfere in the matter than we have.

〈名〉(選挙のは)the successful candidate:(懸賞のは)the prize-winner

content.content: 同船者
a fellow-passenger

content:
どうぞ〔何卒〕
〈副〉(If you) please; kindly

content.content: どうぞそうして下さい
Please do so―Do so, if you please.
どうぞ金を貸して下さいませんか
Will you please―kindly―be so kind as to―be good enough to―have the goodness to―lend me some money?
どうぞおいで下さい
Please come―I request the pleasure of your company.
どうぞおいで下さいませんか
Will you do me the favour of coming?―do me the honour of coming?
どうぞその戸を締めて下さい
May I ask you to shut the door?
ぞうぞその財布を下さい
Please hand me your purse―May I ask you for your purse?
どうぞ五六円貸して下さい
May I trouble you for a few yen?
どうぞその窓をあけて下さい
I will thank you to open the window.
どうぞ水を一杯下さい
I will thank you for a glass of water.
どうぞ早く返事をして下さい
Oblige me with an early answer.
どうぞこの室を出て下さい
Oblige me by leaving the room.
どうぞまた来て下さい
You will perhaps call again.

content.content: 彼は今頃は先方へ到達したろう
He must have reached his destination by this.
道を異にして同じ地点に到達した
We arrived at the same goal by different ways.
どうしてこの断定に到達したか
How did you arrive at this conclusion?―come to this conclusion?
しまいにはどこへ到達するやら
Whither will all this lead?―How will it all end?

content.content: あれは当地の名物です

これが当地の習慣です
This is the custom of the country-side.
当地は蚊が多い
The mosquitoes are very bad here.
ご当地は温かいようですね
It seems to be warm here.

content:
とうち〔統治〕
〈名〉Rule; reign; government:(=する) to rule over (a country or a people) ; to govern (a country or a people)

content.content: 一国を統治する
to rule (over) a country―reign over a country―govern a country
大日本帝国は万世一系の天皇之を統治す(憲法)
The Empire of Japan shall be ruled over by Emperors of a single dynasty from time immemorial.
憲法は国家統治の大法なり
The constitution is the fundamental law according to which the State is governed.
統治者
the ruler―the sovereign
統治権
sovereign power―sovereignty
統治権を行う
to exercise sovereign power
統治機関(政府)
the government

content:
とうちゃく〔到着〕
〈名〉Arrival:(=する) to arrive (at a spot―at a station―in a country―in a city) :(先方へ到着する)to reach (one's destination); to get to (one's journey's end) ; to get there:(物品や手紙なら)to come to hand

content.content: 汽車が停車場に到着する
A train arrives at a station.
船が日本に到着する
A ship arrives in Japan.
彼は東京に到着するや僕を訪ねた
He called on me when he arrived in Tokyo―on his arrival in Tokyo.
到着するや否や
as soon as he arrived―immediately on his arrival
上野に到着した時は日が暮れておった
It was dark when we arrived at Ueno.
彼は今頃は京都に到着したろう
He must have reached Kyoto by this.
目的地に到着する
to reach one's destination―get to one's journey's end
今立ったら何時に到着するでしょうか
If I start now, what time shall I arrive?―get there?
彼は明日到着のはずだ
He is expected here tomorrow.
船は明日到着のはず
The ship is due tomorrow.
無事到着
He has arrived in safety―(物品なら)―It has arrived in good order―arrived in good condition.
小包正に到着
The parcel has duly come to hand―The parcel is duly to hand.
到着港
the port of arrival
到着駅
one's destination―(物品なら)―the receiving station

Your statements are self-contradictory―Your statements contradict each other.

content:

content.content: 道中で
while on a journey―on the road
皆道中の支度をしておった
They were all equipped for the road.
道が遠いから道中で暇をつぶす
The ways are so long that I waste time on the road.
さらば道中つつがなく
I wish you a safe journey―A safe journey to you!―God speed you!
道中はご油断無く
Be careful of yourself on the road!
裸で道中がなるものか
One can not travel without money―One can not live on nothing―One can not live on air.

content:
とうてい〔到底〕
〈副〉
1. (=どうしても、とても)(can not) possibly; (can not) by any possibility; (none) at all; (none) in the world; not nearly (so); nothing like (as); beyond (hope) ; past (all hope)

content.content: 彼はとうてい助からん
He can not possibly be saved―He can not by any possibility be saved―He is beyond help―He is past all help.
とうてい助かる見込みが無い
There is no hope of his recovery in the world―He is beyond hope of recovery―He is past all hope of recovery.
とうてい望みが無い
There is no hope at all―no hope in the world―no possible hope.
とうてい死を免れない
He can not by any possibility escape death.
彼にはとうてい勝てる見込みが無い
I stand no chance at all against him.
君には力ではとうてい及ばない
I am not nearly so strong as you―nothing like as strong as you.
君にはとうていかなわない
I am not nearly a match for you―not a patch upon you.
僕にはとうてい成功はできぬ
I can not possibly succeed―My success is out of the question.
とうてい駄目だ
It is a sheer impossibility―quite impossible―no go.

content: 2. (=結局、つまり)after all; in the end

content.content: 彼はとうてい死を免れぬ
He can not escape death, after all.

a three days' journey

content:

content.content: そんなことはどうでもかまわぬ、どうでもよい
I don't care―It does not matter―That is no matter―That is of no consequence.
そんなことはどうでもよいと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence.
成功しようと失敗しようとどうでもよい

I don't care whether I succeed or fail―It does not matter whether I succeed or fail―Success or failure makes no difference to me―Success or failure is indifferent to me―Success or failure is all one to me.
どうでもするがよい、どうでも好いようにし給え
You may do as you please―do as you think fit.
生徒は教師次第でどうでもなる
The students are wax in the teacher's hands―clay in the potter's hands.
それではどうでも行くのか
Then, must you go?―do you insist on going?
入費はどうでもよい
I don't care about the expense―Never mind the expense!

彼はどうでもこうでも行くと行って聴かない

それではどうでもこうでも行くのか

content.content: そんな尊いお方の前へ出たことが無い

content.content: 幾度も幾度もやってとうとう成功した

1. (=勢よく流れる様)(to flow) with a rush, rapidly, swiftly
2. (=流暢に)fluently; eloquently; effusively

1. (=放蕩) dissipation; debauchery; profligacy; dissolute living; fast living; riotous living; evil ways; evil courses:(=する) to dissipate, be dissipated; to live fast; to lead a fast life; to lead a dissolute life; to lead a dissipated life; to live a riotous life; to go the pace; to run wild; to shake a loose leg:(=なの) dissipated, debauched, dissolute, prodigal, fast (person)

content:
どうり〔道理〕
〈名〉
1. Reason; right; justice; truth; philosophy

content.content: 道理に適う
to consist with reason―accord with reason―stand to reason
この教義は道理に適っている
The doctrine is consistent (with reason).
道理に適った説
a consistent theory―a reasonable doctrine―a rational doctrine
道理に適わぬ、道理に反する、道理に背く、道理にはずれている
It is contrary to reason―against reason―unreasonable.
道理に服す
I am amenable to reason―open to conviction―convincible.
道理に服させる
to convince a person
彼は道理に服さぬ
He is inconvincible―deaf to reason.
道理を説く
to reason with one
彼はいくら道理を説いても聞き分けぬ
He will not listen to reason―come to reason.
どちらが道理か、どちらが無理か
Which is in the right? Which is in the wrong?
自分の方へ道理をつける
to assert oneself to be in the right―prove oneself to be in the right―make oneself out to be in the right
あの人は自分の方へばかり道理をつけるから嫌いさ
I do not like him, for he is always in the right.
それも多少道理がある(それも一理ある)
There is some reason in what you say―There is some truth in that―(を通例略して)―There is something in that.
君がそういうのも道理だ
You have good reason to say so―You may well say so.
彼が誇るのも道理だ
He has good reason to be proud―He may well be proud.
彼は学問を誇っている、それも道理だ
He is proud of his attainments, and with reason―and well he may.
人が権利を主張するのも道理だ
It is right―It is just―It is fair―that a man should assert his rights.
それは道理に合っている、道理に合わぬ
That is good philosophy―bad philosophy.
何事も慾張るのは道理に合わぬ
It is bad philosophy to go beyond bounds in anything.
Plato は霊魂不滅の道理を説く
Plato expounds the philosophy of the immortality of the soul.
無理が通れは道理が引込む
Right gives way to might―Sane people will make way for a madman.
結局道理が勝つ
Right prevails in the end―Truth prevails in the end.
万世不易の道理
eternal truths―immutable laws
これは争うべからざる道理だ
This is an incontrovertible truth.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 道理で
That accounts for it―That accounts for the milk in the cocoa-nut (and the hair on it).
彼は病気なのか、道理で来ないと思った
Is he ill? Ah! That accounts for his absence.
彼は西洋人の家に居たのか、道理で英語がうまい
Has he lived with a foreigner? That accounts for his English.
道理上そうあるべきはずだ
It ought to be so in the nature of things―in the nature of the case.
数が多くなれば品が悪くなるは道理だ
It is in the nature of things―It is natural―that, if a thing gains in quantity, it should lose in quality.
あのように勉強すれば成功する道理だ
It is quite natural―It is no wonder―that, if he works so hard, he should succeed―Such a hard-working man ought to succeed.
君にできないことが僕にできる道理があるか
If you can not do it, how ought I to be able?
そうでなければならない道理だ
It must be so.
ぞんな道理は無い
It can not be so―It is impossible.
彼にこんなことのできる道理は無い
It is impossible that he can do such a thing.
できない道理はない
It is impossible that he can not do it.
今ここへ置いた物が独りで無くなる道理はない
It is impossible that what I laid here can have disappeared of itself.
初学者にこんな本のわかる道理は無い
A beginner can not be expected to understand such books―It is not to be expected that a beginner can understand such books.
勉強すれば成功する道理だ
If a man works hard, he ought to succeed―it is natural that he should succeed―it naturally follows that he will succeed.
人はいくら勉強したからとて必ずしも成功せんならんという道理は無い
Because a man works hard, it does not follow that he must succeed.
人は取るより多く使えば(自然の結果として)借金をする道理だ
If a man spends more than he gets, it follows (as a natural consequence) that he will run into debt.

content:

西洋人の家に居たのか、道理で英語がうまい

The party opinion is inclined to war.

〈名〉Debate:(一回なら) a debate:(=する) to debate (on a question)

content.content: 問題を討論に付す
to put a question to the debate
討論に入る
to enter upon a debate

A debate is going on.

to take sides in the debate

content:
とうわく〔当惑〕
〈名〉Puzzlement; perplexity; confusion:(=する) to be puzzled; to be perplexed; to be confounded; to be at a loss (for an answer); to be at one's wits' end; to be nonplussed; to be at a nonplus; to be in a fix

content.content: この電報には当惑した
This telegram puzzled me―I am puzzled at his telegram―I am at a loss to comprehend the meaning of this telegram.
身に覚えの無い大罪を言い掛けられて実に当惑する
The false charge confounds me―I am confounded at the false accusation.
どうしてよいか処置に当惑した
I am at a loss how to act―perplexed―in perplexity―in a fix.
彼はそう言われてはたと当惑した
Thus admonished, he was at his wits' end―at a nonplus―nonplussed.
彼は当惑面をして帰って来た
He returned with a puzzled countenance.
当惑そうに頭を掻いた
He scratched his head in perplexity―(に相当するは)―slapped his forehead.

content:
どうわすれ〔胴忘れ〕
〈名〉A lapse of memory:(=する) to have (anything) slip one's memory; to forget (for a moment)

content.content: その名を胴忘れした
His name has slipped my memory―I forget his name.
僕は胴忘れして困る
I am subject to lapses of memory.

content:
とお〔十〕
〈名〉Ten

content.content: 十で神童、十五で才子、二十歳越えれば只の人
A prodigy at ten, a genius at fifteen, and a mediocrity after twenty―“A man at sixteen will prove a fool at sixty.”

content:
とおあさ〔遠浅〕
〈名〉A shoaling beach

content.content: 海岸は遠浅になっている
The sea is shallow off the shore.
ここは遠浅で海水浴に適している
The sea is shallow and makes a good watering-place.

content:
とおい〔遠い〕
〈形〉Far; distant; remote

content.content: そこはここから遠いか
Is it far from here to the place?
地球から月までどれほど遠いか
How far is it from the earth to the moon?
そこはここからよほど遠い
It is very far from here―far distant from here.
ヨーロッパは日本から遠い
Europe is far distant from Japan.
遠い国
a far country―a distant country
遠い所
a distant place
(彼は近眼だから)遠い処は見えぬ
He can not see far.
路が遠い
The way is long.
王子までは路が遠い
It is a long way to Oji―Oji is a long way off.
遠い親類
a distant relation
あの人は遠い親類だ
He is distantly related to me.
遠い親類より近い他人
A good neighbour is better than a relation afar off.
遠い昔
remote antiquity
完全にはまだ遠い
It is far from perfect.
目的を達するにはまだ先が遠い
We are still far from our object.
遠くに灯火が見える
I see a light far away―a long way off―in the distance.
遠くから来る
to come from afar
その必要を生ずる時の来るは遠きにあらず
The day is not far distant when the necessity will arise.
当たらずといえども遠からず
You are not far from the mark―You are very nearly right―It is approximate.
遠く離れている
to be far apart
遠く離れて
When far apart are we,
会われぬ時は
And can't each other see,
月が鏡と
Would that the moon could be
なれば好い
A mirror clear to me!
遠からん者は音にも聞け
Ye who are afar, hear and tremble!
近くは寄って目にも見よ
Ye who are near, behold and be blessed!

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 遠く及ばぬ
to be not nearly so good as the other
器量は遠く姉に及ばぬ
She is not nearly so beautiful as her sister―nothing like as beautiful as her sister―far inferior to her sister in beauty―not a patch upon her sister in beauty.
学問は遠く兄に及ばぬ
He is not nearly so good a scholar as his brother―nothing like as good a scholar as his brother―far behind his brother in scholarship―not a patch upon his brother in scholarship.
遠くなる
to recede
船がだんだん遠くなる
A ship recedes from the view.
気が遠くなる
to grow faint
足が遠くなる
to cease to be a frequent visitor
結婚すると足の遠くなる人がある
When some people marry, they let the grass grow on the path of friendship.
耳が遠い
to be hard of hearing―dull of hearing―slow of hearing
遠くて近きは男女の仲
“Man is fire and woman is tow.”
遠く慮る
to be prudent―use prudence
遠き慮りあれば近き憂い無し
Prudence averts danger.
遠き慮り無ければ近き憂い有り
Imprudence courts danger.

content:
とおえん〔遠縁〕
〈名〉Distant relation; distant connection:(=の) distant; distantly related; distantly connected

content.content: 遠縁の親戚
a distant relation―a distant connection

content.content: 十日路
a ten days' journey

a day after the fair

content:
とおからず〔遠からず〕
〈副〉Before long; at no distant date; shortly; soon

content.content: 遠からず全快するだろう
He will get well before long―It will not be long before he gets well.
遠からずその必要を生ずる時来たるべし
The necessity will arise at no distant date―The day is not far distant when the necessity will arise.
遠からず旅行に出かける
I start on a journey shortly.
遠からず便りがあるだろう
I shall hear from him very soon.

content:
とおく〔遠く〕
〈副〉
1. Afar; far away

content.content: 遠くに灯火が見える
I see a light far away―a long way off―in the distance.
遠くへ行く
to go far―go to a distance
君は末だ遠くは
Thou canst not yet
行かじ我袖の
Be far from here:
袂の涙
Still moist on my sleeve
乾き果てねば
Is the parting tear.
遠くから来る
to come from afar
夜の火事は遠くから見える
A fire at night can be seen a long way off―from a great distance.
御神体は遠くからしか拝めない
The image can only be seen from a distance.
互いに遠く離れている
to be far apart
遠く離れて
When far apart are we,
会われぬ時は
And can't each other see,
月が鏡と
Would that the moon could be
なれば好い
A mirror clear to me!
遠くて見えぬ
It is too far to see―too far to be seen.
遠くて百マイル
It is 100 miles distant at the farthest.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 遠く及ばぬ
It is not nearly so good as the other―far inferior to the other.
器量は遠く姉に及ばぬ
She is not nearly so beautiful as her sister―nothing like as beautiful as her sister―far inferior to her sister in beauty―not a patch upon her sister in beauty.
学問は遠く兄に及ばぬ
He is not nearly so good a scholar as his brother―nothing like as good a scholar as his brother―far behind his brother in scholarship―not a patch upon his brother in scholarship.
遠くなる
to recede
船がだんだん遠くなる
A ship recedes from the view.
気が遠くなる
to grow faint
足が遠くなる
to cease to be a frequent visitor
結婚すると足が遠くなる人がある
When some people marry, they let the grass grow on the path of friendship.
遠くて近きは男女の仲
“Man is fire and woman is tow.”
遠く慮る
to be prudent―use prudence

content:
とおざかる〔遠ざかる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=遠くなる)to become more distant; to go farther off; to recede

content.content: 船がだんだん遠ざかる
A ship recedes from view.

content: 2. (=接近せぬ)to keep away from (one); to hold aloof from (the world)

content.content: 彼は世に遠ざかっている
He holds aloof from the world.
親戚や旧友から遠ざかっている
He keep away from his relations and old friends.
僕は久しく教育界から遠ざかっている
I have long been out of the educational world.

content: 3. (=離れる、別れる)to separate; to part

content.content: 飽きも飽かれもせぬ仲を世間の義理ゆえ遠ざかる
We, lovers, must part to satisfy the demands of custom.

content: 4. (=疎遠になる)to be estranged, be alienated (from each other)

content.content: 彼とは遠ざかっている
I am estranged from him―There is a coolness between us.
遠く離れたために二人は遠ざかっている
Distance has cooled their friendship.

content:
とおざける〔遠ざける〕
〈他動〉To keep (a man) at a distance; to keep (a man) at arm's length; to give (a man) a wide berth; to avoid, shun (bad company); to eschew, abstain from (woman); to get rid of (one)

content.content: あのような人は敬して遠ざけるに限る
It is best to keep such men at a distance―give such men a wide berth.
彼は忠義な家来を遠ざけて接近させぬ
He keeps his faithful servants at arm's length.
あのうるさい奴を遠ざけたいものだ
I should like to get rid of that troublesome fellow.
悪友を遠ざける
to avoid bad company―shun evil companions
女を遠ざける
to eschew woman―abstain from woman
外国語を学ぶと人心を愛国心から遠ざけるように思うのは大いなる誤りである
It is a great mistake to think that the study of foreign languages calls one away from love of one's country.
人を遠ざけて話をしよう
We will have a private talk by ourselves―We will talk when we are alone.
人を遠ざけたから何でも話し給え
We are alone. You may talk freely.

content:
とおし〔通し〕
〈形〉Through

content.content: ロンドンまで通しで行く
I shall book through to London―go direct to London.
汽車は青森まで通しだ
The train runs through to Aomori.
通し汽車
a through-train
通し切符
a through-ticket
通し運賃
through-freight
通し船積証券
a through bill of loading

content: 〈接尾詞〉→『

content.content: どおし〔通し〕

content:
どおし〔通し〕
〈接尾詞〉(前置詞に訳せば)through; throughout:(副詞に訳せば)all the time; all the way:(動詞に訳せば)to keep (doing something)

content.content: 夜通し飲んだ
We drank throughout the night―all through the night―all the night through―all night.
ひと晩飲み通しに飲んだ
We kept drinking all night.
彼は働き通しに働いている
He keeps working all the time.
彼女はしゃべり通しにしゃべっている
She keeps talking all the time―She talks nineteen to the dozen.
電車がこんでいて立ち通し
The car was crowded, and I kept standing all the time―kept standing all the way.
歩き通しに歩いた
I walked all the way.

content:
とおす〔通す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=通らす)to let (one) pass; to let (one) by; to pass (anything) through; to let (anything) through; to run (anything) through; to transmit (light or heat)

content.content: 巡査が通してくれた
The policeman let me pass.
ここを通して下さい
Let me by!
よけて通す
to make way for one
群衆は左右に分かれて一行を通した
The crowd prated right and left to make way for the party.
ガラスは光線を通す
Glass transmits light.
この外套は雨を通しはせぬか
Doesn't this overcoat let the rain through?
雨を通さない
It is rainproof―waterproof.
針のめどに糸を通す
to run a thread through a needle's eye―thread a needle
索を通す
to reeve a rope through a ring
紐を通す
to pass a string through a hole
驢馬の足へ棒を通して二人で担いだ
They passed a post between the ass's legs, and carried it on their shoulders between them.
管に水を通す
to run water through a pipe
火を通す
to broil fish―toast bread―do meat thoroughly
忍耐は岩をも通す
“Patience wears out stones.”

content: 2. (=案内して通す)to show (one) in (-to a room); to usher (one) in (-to a room)

content.content: お通し申せ
Show him in!
客間へお通ししろ
Show him into the parlour!
玄関番が客人をていねいに客間へ通した
The door-boy bowed the visitor into the parlour.
二階へお通し申せ
Show him upstairs!
女が灯火を持って僕を二階へ通した
The woman lighted me upstairs.
奥へ通された
I was ushered into the family-room.

content: 3. (=目を通す)to look over, look through, look to (anything); to go over (anything); to run over, run one's eyes over (anything)

content.content: 勘定に目を通しておいて下さい
Please look over the accounts.
書類に目を通したか
Have you looked over the papers?―looked through the papers?
ざっと目を通しておいた
I have run over them―run my eyes over them.
今一度目を通しておこう
I will go over them once more.
主婦は万事に自分で目を通す
The mistress looks to everything herself.
新聞はざっと目を通すだけだ
I merely glance over the papers.
見出しだけに目を通しておく
I only glance at the headings.

content: 4. (=貫徹する)to carry (one's point); to persist in (one's opinion)

content.content: 意見を通す
to carry one's point―gain one's end
我を通す、我意を通す
to persist in one's opinion―have one's own way
僕はどこまでも我を通そうというのではない
I do not persist in my opinion.
彼は自分が言ったことをどこまでも通そうとする
He will persist in his statement.
彼はいったん言い出したら是が非でも通さなけりゃ承知しない
Once he says he will do a thing, he will persist in it, right or wrong.
彼は意地を通さなけれりゃ聴かぬ
He will have his own way.
わがままを通さなけりゃ承知しない
He will have everything his own way.

content: 5. (=続ける)to continue; to remain; to keep (doing something)

content.content: 子どもが一晩泣き通した
The child kept crying all night.
一週間降り通した、一週間通して降った
It has kept raining for a week―It has rained through the week―throughout the week.
生涯独身で通した
(男なら)He remained a bachelor all his life―lived and died a bachelor―(女なら)―She continued single through life―lived and died a virgin
後家を一生立て通した
She remained faithful to the memory of her husband―She remained a widow for the remainder of her life.
彼は忠義を立て通した
He remained faithful to the cause to the end.
女は操を立て通した
She remained faithful to him to the end.
しまいまで我慢し通した者は何人あるか
How many held out to the end?
主義を通す
to adhere to one's principles―stick to one's colours
サンフランシスコでは一つ着物で夏冬通す者がある
In San Francisco, some people wear a single suit summer and winter.
寒中外套無しで通した
I went without an overcoat through the winter.
彼は一時間通してしゃべった

とおのける〔遠退ける〕

自転車遠乗りに行く
to go on a cycling expedition

content:
とおぼえ〔遠吠え〕

content.content: 犬の遠吠え
the howling of a dog
狼の遠吠は気味の悪いものだ
The howling of a wolf will make one's blood run cold.

content:

content.content: 敵を遠巻きにした

遠巻きにしてじりじり攻め寄せた

content:
とおまわしに〔遠廻しに〕
〈副〉In a roundabout way; indirectly; periphrastically; euphemistically

content.content: 遠まわしに言う
to hint―insinuate―innuendo
僕は遠まわしに言うことや言われることが大嫌いだ
I hate hints and insinuations―hints and innuendoes.
遠まわしに人の意向を探る
to beat about the bush―feel out one's views―sound one's views―feel one's pulse

content:
とおまわり〔遠廻り〕
〈名〉A roundabout way; a circuitous route; a circuit; a d?tour:(=する) to make a circuit; to make a d?tour; to go a long way about

content.content: それではたいへんな遠廻りだ
It will be going a long way about―going very much out of your way.

content:
とおみ〔遠見〕

1. (=遠望、遠景)a distant view

content.content: 遠見が利く

content: 2. (=遠見櫓)a watch-tower

とおみち〔遠路〕

2. (=遠廻り)→『

content.content: とおまわり〔遠廻り〕

content:
とおめ〔遠目〕
〈名〉
1. (=遠望)a distant view

content.content: 遠目に見ては違いがわからぬ
You can not see the difference at a distance―from a distance.
あの娘は遠目が好い
She looks to advantage at a distance.
夜目遠目傘の内

content: 2. (=遠視)far-sightedness; long-sightedness; hypermetropia

content.content: 船乗りは遠目が利く

とおめがね〔遠眼鏡〕

content:
とおり〔通り〕
〈名〉
1. (=町)a street; the streets(は市街)

content.content: 通りを通る
to pass along a street―walk down a street
この通りは往来が頻繁だ
The street is much frequented.
この通りは人通りが少ない
The street is unfrequented.
この通りについて行くと橋がある
If you follow this street, you will come to a bridge.
君は通りで逢ったら見違えるほど変わった
If I met you in the streets, I should not know you.
大通り、本通り
the main street―the high street
ひとどおり〔人通り〕

content:
』
3. (=疏通)passage

content.content: 下水の通りが好いか
Does the sewer drain well?―Does the drain act well?
通りが悪い
It does not drain―It acts badly―It clogs.
この煙管{きせる}は通りが好い、通りが悪い
The pipe draws well―draws badly.
通りを好くする
to clear the passage―clean the pipe

content: 4. (=人望)popularity; favour

content.content: 彼は上官に通りが好い
He is in favour with his seniors―in good odour with his seniors.
僕は先生方に通りが悪い
I am out of favour with my teachers―in bad odour with my teachers.
あれは通りの好い男だ
He is a popular man―the sort of man to get on.

content: 5. (=組)a set

content.content: 家具が一通り揃った
We have now a complete set of furniture.

content: 6. (=種類)a kind

content.content: 品が三通りあります
We have three kinds of goods.

content: 7. (=方法)a way

content.content: 書き方が二通りある
There are two ways of writing it.
ひととおり〔一と通り〕

content:
』
〈副〉(=何分通り)percent

content.content: 普請は三分通りできた
The building is thirty percent completed―nearly half completed.
工事は九分通りでき上がった
The works are ninety percent completed―very nearly completed.
花が三分通り咲いた、七分通り咲いた
The blossoms are nearly half open―more than half open.

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=如き)like

content.content: この通りの家が欲しい
I want a house like this one.
あの通り手を合わして拝んでいます
She is folding her hands and worshipping you in that way.

content: 2. (=倣って)after

content.content: 手本の通りに書く
to write after the copy
この手本の通りに上衣をこしらえておくれ
Make my coat after this model.

content: 3. (=従って)according to; agreeably to; pursuant to; in accordance with

content.content: ご規則通り
according to rule―in accordance with the rules―in compliance with the regulations
約束通り
agreeably to my promise
命令通り
pursuant to my orders
形の通り儀式を済ました
The ceremony was gone though according to the usual form―in due form―in form.
計画通りに実行する
I will adhere to the plan.
決心通りに実行する
I will act up to my resolution.
彼は予想通り失敗した
He has failed according to my expectations.
結果は予想通りだ
The result is as I expected.
結果は予想通りにいった、予想通りにはいかぬ
The result has come up to my expectations―fallen short of my expectations.
予想通りの結果を得た
I have obtained the expected result.
望み通りの品が無い
I can not find the desired article.
汽車は時間通りに発着するか
Are the trains on schedule time?
番組通りにやれば今度は君の番だ
If they follow the programme, it is your turn next.

content: 〈接続詞〉(=如く)as

content.content: 右の通り
as above
左の通り
as follows:―
いつもの通り
as usual―as of old
当日雨天ならば平日の通り授業がある
If it rains on the day, there will be school as usual.
ご覧の通り
as you see
ご覧の通りなかなか書きます
He writes very well, you see.
子どもが多いからご覧の通りの始末です
We have so many children that you see the state we are in.
ご承知の通り
as you know
ご承知の通り不具者ですから
He is deformed, you know.
ご承知の通り失敗しましたから
I have failed, as you know too well.
お話した通り
as I told you
お話の通りです
It is just as you say―It is all you say―He is all you tell me.
思った通りだ
It is just as I thought―I was right in my conjectures.
僕が恐れた通りであった
It was as I had feared.
私が言う通りになさい
Do as I tell you!
言われた通りになさい
Do as you are told to!
言われた通りにさえしていりゃ好いのだ
You have only to do as you are bidden―You have only to do his bidding.
聞いた通り言ってご覧
Repeat it as you heard―Repeat it word for word.
僕が予期した通りだ
It is as I expected.
この通り独り住まいですから何もご馳走はありません
Living, as I do, all by myself, I have nothing to offer you.
予定の通り本日到着しました
He has arrived today as previously arranged.
この品は註文通りでない
The article is not made as ordered.
ご註文通りにこしらえたつもりですが
I hope we have made it as you ordered it.
冗談に言ったらその通りになった
What I said in joke, has come out true.
僕の予言した通りになったから見給え
My prediction has come true.

content:
どおり〔通り〕
〈接尾詞〉
1. According to; agreeably to; pursuant to; in accordance with; as

content.content: ご規則通り
according to rule―in accordance with the regulations
ご意見通りに規則を変更しました
We have altered the regulations in accordance with your views.
約束通り
agreeably to my promise
命令通り
pursuant to my orders
この品は注文通りでない
The article is not made as ordered.
ご註文通りにこしらえたつもりですが
We have made it as you ordered it.
予定通り本日到着
He has arrived today as previously arranged.
何事も予想通りに行くことはめったに無い
Things seldom come up to our expectations.
僕は決心通りに実行する
I will act up to my resolution.
汽車は時間通りに発着するか
Are the trains on time?―on schedule time?
番組通りにやれば今度は君の番だ
If they follow the programme, it is your turn next.
花は三四分通り咲いた
The blossoms are nearly half out.
花は二三分通り咲いた
The blossoms are peeping out.
花は七八分通り咲いた
The blossoms are mostly out.
仕事は七八分通り片づいた
My works is more than half finished.
工事は八九分通り出来上がった
The works are nearly completed.

とおりあめ〔通り雨〕
〈名〉A passing rain; a shower

とおりあわせる〔通り合わせる〕

通り一遍の挨拶
the usual greetings―a formal greeting

a passer-by―a chance passenger

content:
とおりかかる〔通り掛かる〕

content.content: そこへ巡査が通りかかった

content:
とおりこす〔通り越す〕
〈他動〉To pass (a point); to go past (a place)

content.content: 居眠りして目的の停車場を通り越した

もうその家を通り越したのじゃないか
Have we not passed the house?―gone past the house?
考え込んでいるうちに家の前を通り越した
I passed the house―walked past the house―while I was absorbed in thought.
暴風雨が日本を通り越して日本海へ出た
The storm passed over Japan into the Japan Sea.
この暴風雨はじきに通り越す
This storm will soon blow over.
銃弾がヒューと頭の上を通り越した

的を通り越す
to overshoot the mark

とおりことば〔通り言葉〕
〈名〉The cant, the lingo, the jargon, the patter (of a class, a party, or a profession); (thieves') argot, cant, slang

とおりすぎる〔通り過ぎる〕
〈自他動〉To pass (a place); to go past (a place); to pass on

I made a bow and passed on.
知らずに家の前を通りすぎた
I passed the house―went past the house―walked past the house―without knowing it.

content.content: すれちがう〔擦れ違う〕

content:
とおりぬけ〔通り抜け〕
〈名〉Passing through:(=る) to pass through (a place)

content.content: この町を通り抜けると橋がある
After you pass through this street, you will see a bridge.
この路地は通り抜けられますか
Can one pass through this alley?
この路地は通り抜けられません
You can not pass through this alley―It is a blind alley.
通り抜け無用
No thoroughfare.

content:
とおりみち〔通り路〕
〈名〉A passage; a route; one's way (to some place)

content.content: 通り路の邪魔をするな
Do not stand in my way―Get out of my way.
通り路を明ける
to clear the passage

to clear the passage from obstacles
