The house lies in my way to school.

content:
とおりもの〔通り者〕
〈名〉A well-known person:(形容詞に訳せば)well-known; proverbial

content.content: 彼の吝嗇は通り者だ
He is a well-known miser―a proverbial miser―proverbially stingy.

content:
とおる〔通る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=通行する)to pass; to pass along (a street); to go down (a street); to pass through (a corridor)

content.content: 今人が通った
A man passed just now.
馬で通った
He rode past.
馬車で通った
He drove past.
歩いて通った
He walked past.
走って通った
He ran past.
馬車が通った
A carriage swept past.
自動車が通った
A motor-car flashed past.
人っ子一人通らない
Not a soul is to be seen in the streets―The streets are deserted.
通りを通る
to pass along a street―(歩いてなら)―walk down a street―(馬でなら)―ride down a street―(馬車でなら)―drive down a street―(走ってなら)―run down a street［注意］上り坂の場合に限って“down”の代りに“up”を用いる。
行列はこの町を通る
The procession will pass along this street―pass through this street.
どの道を通って行くか
By which way are you going?
本町を通って来た
I came by the High Street.
通りは馬車で通れぬ
The street is blocked with carriages.
この道はとても通れぬ
This road is impassable―impracticable.
この通りは自動車が通れぬ
A motor-car can not pass through this street―This street does not admit a motor-car.
この通りは自動車が二台並んで通れぬ
Motor-cars can not run two abreast through this street.
家の前を通る
to pass a house―go past a house
あの家は素通りに通れぬ
I can not pass that house without looking in.
君は学校へ行く時郵便局の前を通らないか
Shall you not pass the Post Office on your way to school?
毎日お門を通ります
I pass your door every day.
あの人は毎日馬で通る
He rides past (my house) every day.
今自動車で通った
He rode past in a motor-car just now.
通れ
(関守が言えば)Pass on!―(乞食に向かって言えば)―Get along with you!―Off with you!

content: 2. (=通過する)to pass through (a town or a country); to pass (the House, etc.)

content.content: あの町を通ったことがある
I once passed through that town.
今通った村はどこでしたか
What was the village we passed through just now?
ヨーロッパへ行く時米国を通った
I passed through America on my way to Europe.
米国を素通りに通った
I passed through America without stopping there.
米国を通って欧州へ行った
I went to Europe by way of America―via America.
関所を通る
to pass through a barrier
汽車が停車場を通る
A train passes a station.
今通った station はどこでしたか
What was the station we passed just now?
鉄道が市街を通る
The railway runs through the city.
列車が隧道を通る
A train runs through a tunnel.
列車が橋を通る
A train passes a bridge.
船が運河を通る
A ship passes through a canal.
戦闘艦は巨砲を下ろさなければ Suez の運河が通れぬ
A battleship can not pass through the Suez canal unless she is lightened of her big guns.
道路が崕縁を通る
The road runs along a precipice.
議案は両院を通った
The bill has passed both Houses.
試験を通る
to pass an examination
人込みを通る
to pass through a crowd―(押して通れば)―push one's way through a crowd―elbow one's way through a crowd
たいへんな人でとても通れぬ
There is an immense crowed, and I can't make my way through it.
喉を通る
to go down the throat
病人は何を食っても喉を通らぬ
No food will go down his throat―He rejects all kinds of food.

content: 3. (=打通る、貫く)to run through (a house); to traverse (a country)

content.content: 廊下が縦に通っている
A corridor runs through the building.
鉄道が半島の端から端へ通っている
A railway runs through the peninsula.
この糸は太くて針のめどを通らない
The thread is too thick to run through the needle's eye.
この辺は鉄道が縦横に通っている
The country is traversed by railways in all directions―The country is a network of railways.
土管がふさがって水が通らぬ
The pipe is choked, and does not allow the water to flow.
この外套は雨が通る
This overcoat lets the rain through.
雨が通らぬ
It is rainproof―waterproof.
煙管{きせる}が通るか
Does the pipe draw well?
通らぬ
It does not draw.
よく通る声だ
His voice reaches far―carries far―It is a penetrating voice―a piercing voice.
いくら大きい声を出しても通らない
I can not make myself heard.
この講堂は声が通る、声が通らぬ
The hall has good acoustic properties―bad acoustic properties.
この魚は火が通らない
The fish is not done enough.

content: 4. (=通用する)to pass current; to pass muster; to pass (for or as something)

content.content: こんな品は通らぬ
Such articles will not pass muster.
こんなばかばかしい説が世間を通っているからおかしい
It is strange that such absurd stories should pass current.
これなら本物で通る
The article will pass for genuine―pass as genuine.
彼は英学の大家で通っている
He passes for a great English scholar―He is acknowledge as an authority on English.
あれでも学者で通っているからおかしい
It is strange that he should pass for a scholar.
彼は学者で通ろうとする
He tries to pass himself off for a scholar.
大きな顔をして世間を通れる人間じゃない
He can not pass for a respectable man.
彼は通称儀助で通っている
He goes by the name of Gisuke―He is commonly known as Gisuke.

content: 5. (=入る)to enter; to come in:(通される)to be shown in

content.content: どうぞお通りください
Please come in!
ずっとお通りなさい
Come right in!
応接間へ通った
I was shown into the parlour.

content: 6. (=容れられる)to pass; to prevail (with some one)

content.content: そんな言い訳は通らぬ
Such excuses will not pass.
そんなばかばかしい理屈が通るものか
How can such absurd arguments pass?
議論が通らなければ威圧するよりほかは無い
If arguments will not prevail with him, we must resort to coercive measures.
彼は大臣に意見が通る
He has influence with the minister.

content: 7. (=届く、叶う)to be attained; to be gained; to be fulfilled; to be realized

content.content: 思いが通る
to attain one's desire―gain the desire of one's heart
日頃の思いが通った
My cherished desire is fulfilled.
とてもと思った望みが通った
My wildest wishes have been realized―My wildest hopes have been fulfilled.

content:
とおる〔透る〕
〈自動〉To penetrate; to pierce; to permeate

content.content: 水の透らぬ岩層がある
There is a stratum impervious to water.
油紙は水が透らぬ
Oil-paper is impervious to water―proof against water―water proof.
この靴は水が透る
Those shoes let the water through.
ガラスは光線が透る
Class is transparent.
紙は明かりが透る
Paper is translucent.

content:
とおれる〔通れる〕
〈自動〉To be passable:(形容詞に用いれば)passable

content.content: この峠は冬は通れない
The pass is impassable―impracticable―in winter.

content:
とか〔都下〕
〈名〉The capital; the metropolis

content.content: 都下の新聞
the town papers
都下の名所を探る
to see the sights of the capital

content:
とが〔科〕
〈名〉
1. (=罪科)charge

content.content: 彼は謀殺の科で死刑になった
He was hanged on a charge of murder―hanged for murder.
科人
a criminal―a convict―a culprit―an offender

content: 2. (=あやまち、責め)a fault; blame

content.content: 誰の科か
Whose fault is it?―Who is to blame for it?
自分の科だ
It is your own fault―You are to blame for it yourself.
誰の科でもない自分の科だ
It is no one's fault but your own―No one is to blame but yourself.
彼は何の罪も科も無い
He is not to blame―free from blame―innocent.
罪も科も無い者を罰するとはひどい
It is hard of them to punish an innocent man.

とが〔都雅〕
〈形〉Urbane; polished; refined; elegant

とかい〔渡海〕
〈名〉Crossing the sea; a passage:(=する) to cross the sea; to take a passage

content:
とかい〔都会〕
〈名〉A city; a town:(=の) urban

content.content: 大都会
a large city
小都会
a small town
繁華な都会
a bustling town
都会人
a city-dweller―an urbanite
都会生活
city life―town life
都会風
city manners―urban manners
子どもは都会育ちだ
The children are city-bred.

content:
どがい〔度外〕
〈名〉Neglect

content.content: (事実などを)度外に置く
to neglect a fact―leave a fact out of account

どがいしする〔度外視する〕
〈他動〉To disregard, ignore, neglect, overlook, pass over (anything); to leave (a fact) out of account; to leave (a fact) out of consideration; to take no account of (a fact)

content:
とかき〔斗掻〕
〈名〉A strickle

content.content: 桝に斗掻をかける
to strike the measure

content:
とかく〔兎角〕
〈副〉(=ともすれば)(to be) apt (to do something)

content.content: 人はとかくそう思う
People are apt to think so.
若いうちはとかく男女間の間違いがありがちだ
Young people are apt to be indiscreet―Young people will be indiscreet.
人はとかく自分には欠点の無いものと思う
A man is apt to think himself faultless.
世間はとかくうるさいものだ
People will talk.
とかく浮世は色と酒
Wine and woman rule the world.

content: 〈形〉(=かれこれ)this and that; various

content.content: 大臣になるととかくの批評は免れぬ
A minister is subject to various criticisms.
そのことからとかくの沙汰になった
The circumstance gave rise to various rumours.

content: 〈熟語〉

content.content: とかくするうちに
in the meantime―meanwhile

content:
とかげ〔蜥蜴〕
〈名〉The lizard

content.content: 七面蜥蜴
the chameleon

とかす〔解かす〕
〈他動〉To comb (the hair)

content:
とかす〔溶かす〕
〈他動〉To melt (ice) ; to dissolve (salt in water) ; to liquefy (a solid)

content.content: 氷を溶かす
to melt ice
雪を溶かす
to melt snow―dissolve snow
砂糖を水に溶かす
to dissolve sugar in water
バタを溶かす
to liquefy butter―melt butter

content:
とかす〔鎔かす〕
〈他動〉To melt (iron) ; to fuse (steel) ; to smelt (ore)

content.content: 鋼鉄を鎔かす
to melt steel―fuse steel
(金銀を取るために)鉱石を鎔かす
to smelt ore
電光はよく白金をも鎔かす
Lightning will fuse platinum.
古い金貨は皆鎔かしてしまう
Old gold coins go into the crucible.

content:
どかた〔土方〕
〈名〉A navvy

content.content: 土方組
a squad of navvies
土方言葉
bad language―low language

content:
とがった〔尖った〕
〈形〉Pointed; sharp at the end

content.content: 先の尖った棒
a pointed rod―a rod sharp at the end
角{つの}は先が尖っている
The horn is pointed―sharp at the end.
爪先の尖った靴
shoes with pointed toes

content:
どかと〔ドカと〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: どっかと〔ドッカと〕

content:
どかと〔ドカと〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: どっかと〔ドッカと〕

とがにん〔科人〕
〈名〉
1. (=罪人)a criminal; a convict
2. (=犯人)a culprit; an offender

content:
とがめ〔咎め〕
〈名〉
1. Fault-finding ; carping; cavilling; blame; censure; rebuke; reproof; reprimand:(=る) to find fault with, quarrel with (one's words or actions) ; to carp at, cavil at (faults) ; to peck at (flaws) ; to blame, censure, rebuke, reprove, reprimand (one for a fault) ; (a sentry) challenges (a passer-by)

content.content: 人の言行を咎める
to find fault with one's words or actions
この本に間違いは少しあるが咎めることは止そう
I will not quarrel with a few mistakes in the book.
人の過去を咎める
to blame one for a fault―censure one for a fault―rebuke one for a fault―reprove one for a fault
あの人は口やかましく人の過去を咎める
He will cavil at faults―carp at faults―peck at flaws―He is a caviller―a captious man―a fault-finder.
砲台の側へ寄って番兵に咎められた
I went too near the batteries, and was challenged by the sentry.
夜遅く外を歩いて巡査に咎められた
I was out walking late at night, and was challenged by a policeman.
その土手に登ると巡査に咎められるぞ
If you climb that bank, you will get into trouble with the policeman.
生徒がよくあの先生の間違いを咎める
The students often catch him in errors―catch him tripping.
若い者は暴飲暴食しても何の咎めも無い
The young can commit excesses with impunity.
天の与うる処を取らざればかえって咎めあり
“Take the good the gods provide,” or you will incur their wrath.
良心の咎め
compunction―pricks of conscience―qualms of conscience―pangs of remorse
良心が咎める
My conscience pricks me―My conscience twinges me―My conscience smites me―I feel the qualms of conscience―I feel the pangs of remorse―I have compunction in doing so.
気が咎める
I feel the qualms of conscience―I feel guilty.
気が咎めてこの金は取れぬ
It goes against my conscience to take this money.

content: 3. (=炎症)inflammation:(=る) to inflame; to be inflamed

content.content: 傷が咎めた
The cut is inflamed.
髪剃で切ったのが咎めたのだ
A razor cut has caused an inflammation.
灸を咎めて熱が出た
The moxa cautery has caused an inflammation, and brought on a fever.

content:
とがめだて〔咎め立て〕
〈名〉Fault-finding; cavilling; carping:(=する) to find fault with (one) ; to cavil at (faults) ; to carp at (faults); to peck at (flaws)

content.content: 長者を咎め立てするのはふさわしくない
It does not become a young man to find fault with his superiors.
口やかましく咎め立てする人だ
He will cavil at faults―carp at faults―peck at flaws―He is a caviller―a captious man―a fault-finder.

content:
とがらす〔尖らす〕
〈他動〉To sharpen; to point

content.content: 鉛筆を尖らす
to sharpen a pencil
棒を尖らす
to point a stick
神経を尖らす
to have one's nerves on edge
口を尖らす
to pout one's lips―make a pout―make a lip
声を尖らす
to raise an angry voice

とがる〔尖る〕
〈自動〉To be pointed; to come to a point; to taper to a point; to be sharp at the end

どかん〔土管〕
〈名〉An earthen pipe

content:
とき〔時〕
〈名〉
1. (=時間、時日)time; hour

content.content: 時計は時を告げる
The clock tells the hour.
時計は時を打つ
The clock strikes the hour.
時は何時か
What is the time?―What time is it?
時は九時
It is nine o'clock.
時はまだ早い
It is still early.
時は金なり
“Time is money.”
時の問題だ
It is a question of time.
要するに時と金の問題だ
In short, it is a question of time and money.
時と金をうっちゃるようなものだ
It is a mere waste of time and money―It will be time and money thrown away.
時がたつ、時が移る
Time passes―Time elapses―Time goes by―Time goes on.
時が早くたつ
Time flies.
面白く遊んでいると時が早くたつ
Pleasure makes the hours fly.
忙しいから時のたつのを知らずにいた
I was so busy that I took no note of time.
閑談時の移るを知らず
Time passed without our knowing while we were chatting pleasantly.
時を経るに従って決心が固くなった
My resolution became firmer as time went by―with the lapse of time.
時がたてばわかる
You will know it in course of time―in process of time.
時がたてば自然とわかる
Time will show.
時がたてばどちらが無理かわかる
Time will show which is in the wrong.
時がたてばたつほどこちらの利益だ
Time is in our favour.
時がたてばたつほど先方の不利益だ
Time is against the other party.
時が迫っている
Time presses―We are pressed for time.
何に時を費す
to spend one's time―pass one's time―in doing something
相談に多くの時を費した
We spent much time in consultation.
この本は時を費す甲斐が有る
It is worth while to read the book.
時をつぶす
to waste time
時を無駄にするな(一寸の光陰軽んずべからず)
Do not waste time!―Improve every moment!
何に時を過す、時を移す
to pass one's time in doing something
空談に時を移した
We passed our time in empty talk.
時を移さず行ってみた
I lost no time in going to see it―I at once went to see it.
彼はいつも時を誤らぬ
He is always punctual―on time.

content: 2. (=時期)time; occasion; season; moment

content.content: あの時はまだ子どもだった
I was a mere boy at that time―then.
この時なり(この機逸すべからず)
Now is the time―Now or never!
ある時
once―one time―on one occasion
この時に当たって大事が勃発した
At that time,―At that moment,―there happened a great event.
時の内閣
the Cabinet of the time―the then Cabinet
何事も時あり
There is a time for everything.
今は兄弟墻{かき}に鬩{せめ}ぐの時にあらず
This is no time for quarrelling among ourselves.
時と場所を指定する
to appoint the time and place
君はちょうど好い時に来た
You have come just at the right moment―You have come in the nick of time―You are just in time.
時のはずみで彼はどんな嘘でもつく
He will tell any lie on the spur of the moment―on the impulse of the moment.
飯時
meal-time―dinner-hour
収穫時
harvest-time
花時
the flowery season―the cherry season

content: 3. (=場合)case; occasion; season; time

content.content: その時は死ぬばかりさ
In that case―Then―I can but die.
その時はその時のことさ
In that case, we shall take measures accordingly.
さすがの頑固老翁もこの時ばかりは主義を曲げた
The rigid disciplinarian for once departed from his principles.
それは時と場合さ
That depends (on circumstances).
彼は時を嫌わずしゃれる
He is witty in season and out of season.
彼らは時を嫌わず(時ともなしに)やって来る
They will come at all hours―at all sorts of inconvenient hours.
彼は時によってはなかなか吹く
He will draw the long bow on occasion.
時に応じて場所を定める
We shall fix upon the place as the occasion may demand.
時としては
on some occasions―in some cases―sometimes
彼は時としては早起き、時としては朝寝坊する
He will rise sometimes early―and sometimes late.
時としてはこの規則の当たらぬことがある
There are cases where―There are occasions when―this rule does not hold true.
それも時にとっての一興だ
This will add a zest to the occasion.
彼の不在なのが時にとっての幸せであった
His absence was lucky.
国家危急存亡の秋であった
It was a national crisis.

content: 4. (=機会、機運)chance; opportunity; time; season; fortune; luck

content.content: 時は得難く失いやすし
“Take time by the forelock.”
時を待つ
to abide one's time
時こそ来たれと悦んだ
I thought my time had come.
時を窺う
to watch for a chance
時を得る
to get a chance―(時よろしきを得るの意味なら)―to be timely―well-timed―seasonable―opportune
時を得たる処置だ
It is a timely measure―an opportune measure.
時を得ざる、時ならぬ
untimely―ill-timed―unseasonable―inopportune
時を得ざる干渉だ
It is an untimely interference―an inopportune intervention.
時ならぬ天候だ
It is unseasonable weather.
時ならぬ花
a flower out of season
時を得ざる英雄
an unappreciated genius
時に逢う
to come to luck―be fortunate―prosper
孔子も時に逢わず
Great men and great fortune rarely come together.
時に逢わば散るも
Scatter to the mountain gale
目出度し山桜
When Please the powers above!
愛づるは花の
For not alone in blossom full
盛りのみかは
Do I thee, Cherry, love.

content: 5. (=時世)the times

content.content: 時に従う
to conform to the times―swim with the stream
時に逆う
to go against the time―swim against the stream

content:
6. (=文法の時)tense
7.

content.content: 雄鶏が時をつくる
A cock crows.
牝鶏勧めて雄鶏時をつくる
The hen sets the cock crowing.
牝鶏時をつくれば家亡ぶ
When the hen crows, the house goes to ruin.

content: 〈接続詞〉When; if; in case

content.content: 彼は若い時に欧米を漫遊した
He visited Europe and America when he was young―in his youth.
子どもの時に学校はいっしょだった
We attended the same school when we were boys―in our boyhood.
彼は幼い時に両親に死に別れた
He lost his parents when he was a child―in his infancy.
失敗した時は再興を図る
If I should fail,―In case I should fail,―In case of failure,―In the event of failure,―I will try again.
十五の時に国を出た
I left home when I was fifteen―at the age of fifteen―at fifteen (years of age)―at fifteen (years old).
雨が降る時はどうして遊ぶか
How do you amuse yourself when it rains?―in rainy weather?―in wet weather?
暇な時に読んでみよう
I will read it when I am at leisure―when I have time to spare.
その報は最も待ち設けない時に来た
The news arrived at a time when it was least expected.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 初めて彼に逢った時は変な男だと思った
The first time I met him, I thought him a strange man.
この次に会った時そう言っておこう
The next time I see him, I will say so.
この前会った時は無事でおった
The last time I saw him, he was quite well.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉At; in; in time of; in case of; in the event of; in the hour of; in the moment of; in the day of; during

content.content: 彼は試験の時に病気になった
He fell ill at the examination.
裁判の時に僕は証人に呼び出された
I was summoned as witness at the trial.
火事の時はどこへ逃げようか
Where shall I go in case of fire?
地震の時はこの家は逃げ場が無い
The house is a man-trap in time of an earthquake.
あの人は子どもの時から知っている
I have known him from a child.
これは日露戦争の時に造った船だ
The ship was built during the Russo-Japanese War.
日露戦争は桂内閣の時であった
The Russo-Japanese War took place under the administration of Marquis Katsura.
一朝事有る時は身を国家に捧げん
I shall offer myself to the State in case of emergency―in the day of trouble.
まさかの時に間に合う友は少ない
Most friends will fail you in time of need―in case of need―in the hour of need.
いざという時役に立たぬ
It will not avail you in the hour of danger―in the moment of action.
すわという時は親知らず子知らず
Everybody for himself in the moment of peril.
いよいよという時へこたれた
He faltered at the last moment―at the critical moment―at the supreme moment.
この危急存亡の時にそんなことを言っていられん
We can not concern ourselves with such matters in this crisis―in this emergency―in this exigency.
国家危急存亡の時に功を樹てた
He rendered service in a national crisis.

content:
とき〔鴇〕
〈名〉The Japanese crested ibis

content.content: 鴇色
pink

content:
とぎ〔伽〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おとぎ〔お伽〕

content:
とぎ〔研ぎ〕
〈名〉Whetting; polish

content.content: この刀は研ぎが好い
The sword is well polished.

content:
どき〔怒気〕
〈名〉Anger; wrath

content.content: 怒気満面に溢る
One is red with anger―white with anger―black with anger.
彼は怒気を含んでいる
He is boiling with anger―He is filled with wrath―He harbours a vexed mood.
怒気を含んでそう言った
He said so in an angry tone.

ときあかし〔説き明し〕
〈名〉Explanation

ときあかす〔説き明す〕
〈他動〉To explain

ときおよぶ〔説き及ぶ〕
〈他動〉To refer to (a subject)

content:
ときおり〔時折〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: おりおり〔折々〕

ときがし〔時貸し〕
〈名〉Trust; credit:(=する) to give (one) credit (for 100 yen, etc.)

ときしもあれ〔時しもあれ〕
〈副〉Just then; at this juncture

content:
ときすすめ〔説き勧め〕
〈名〉Persuasion:(=る) to try to persuade (one)

content.content: いくら説き勧めても承知せぬ
I have tried to persuade him, but in vain―I can not prevail upon him―He is not to be prevailed upon.

content:
とぎすます〔研ぎ澄ます〕
〈他動〉To burnish (a blade, etc.)

content.content: 研ぎ澄ました刃
a burnished blade

とぎだし〔研出し〕
〈名〉A design in lacquer brought out by polishing

とぎだす〔研出す〕
〈他動〉To bring out (a design in lacquer) by polishing

content:
ときたま〔時偶〕
〈副〉At long intervals; once in a long while

content.content: 彼は時たま来ることがある
He will come at long intervals.

content:
ときつかぜ〔時津風〕
〈名〉A seasonable wind; a favourable wind

content.content: 時津風枝も鳴らさぬ御世
a peaceful reign

content:
ときつける〔説き付ける〕
〈他動〉To talk (one) over or round to persuade (one to do something)

content.content: やっと説きつけて納得さした
I have at last talked him into compliance―persuaded him to comply.
説きつけて我が党に引き入れた
I have talked him over to my views.
説きつけて仕事を引き受けさした
I have persuaded him to undertake the work.

content:
ときどき〔時々〕
〈副〉
1. (=時として)sometimes

content.content: 彼は時々遊びに来ては一日遊んで行く
He will sometimes come to see me, and stay all day.

content: 2. (=折々)at times; occasionally; (every) now and then; once in a while

content.content: それでも時々本を開くことがある
But he will open a book at times―once in a way.
時々思い出したように勉強する
He works by fits and starts―by snatches―by catches.

content: 3. (=繁々)from time to time; often; frequently; several times

content.content: 御地の商況を時々御報知下さい
You will please advise me of the state of your market from time to time.
時々思い出す
I often think of it.
時々目を覚ます
I wake up several times during the night―I have a broken sleep.

content:
ドキドキ
〈副〉Pit-a-pat:(=する) to go pit-a-pat; to throb; to palpitate

content.content: 胸がドキドキする
My heart throbs.
胸がドキドキしながらそこを出た
I left the place with a beating heart.
名を呼ばれた時胸がドキドキした
On hearing my name called, my heart went pit-a-pat―I felt a flutter in my breast.
ドキドキするような白刃
a flashing blade

content:
ときとして〔時として〕
〈副〉Sometimes; in some cases; on some occasions

content.content: 彼は時としては早起き、時としては朝寝をする
He will rise sometimes carly, and sometimes late.
時としてこの規則の当たらぬことがある
There are cases where―There are occasions when―this rule does not hold true.

content:
ときともなしに〔時ともなしに〕
〈副〉At all hours

content.content: 彼らは時ともなしに来ては勉強の邪魔をする
They will come at all sorts of inconvenient hours, and disturb me in my studies.

ときならず〔時ならず〕
〈副〉Untimely; unseasonably; inopportunely

content:
ときならぬ〔時ならぬ〕
〈形〉Untimely; ill-timed; unseasonable; inopportune

content.content: 時ならぬ天候だ
It is unseasonable weather.
時ならぬ花
a flower out of season

content:
ときに〔時に〕
〈副〉
1. (=折りに触れて) occasionally; on occasion

content.content: 彼は時にはなかなか吹く
He will draw the long bow on occasion.
時に之を習う(論語)
to practise virtue on occasion

content:
2. 
〈話題を転ずる言葉〉By the bye; apropos

content.content: 時に彼はなぜ止めたのか
By the bye, why has he left?
時に君に言うことがある
Apropos, I have something to say to you.

content:
ときのこえ〔鯨波〕
〈名〉A war-cry; a shout of triumph

content.content: 鯨波を上げる
to give a war-cry―give a shout of triumph

ときはずれ〔時外れ〕
〈形〉Untimely; ill-timed; unseasonable; inopportune

content:
ときふせる〔説き伏せる〕
〈他動〉To convince; to confute (one in argument) ; to talk (one) into silence; to reason (one) into compliance

content.content: やっと説き伏せた
At last I have reasoned him into compliance.
説き伏せて決心を翻さした
I have reasoned him out of his resolution.
説き伏せて我が党に引き入れた
I have talked him over to my views.
どうしても彼を説き伏せることができなかった
To do my best, I could not convince him.

ときほどく〔解きほどく〕
〈他動〉To unsew, unstitch (a garment) ; to unknit, unravel (a stocking, etc.)

content:
どぎまぎする
〈自動〉To be disconcerted; to lose one's composure; to feel nervous

content.content: 先生はむずかしい質問を受けてどぎまぎした
He was disconcerted by a hard question.
初めて演壇に立つとどぎまぎする
The first time one stands on the platform, one will feel nervous―lose one's composure.

content:
ときめく〔時めく〕
〈自動〉To prosper; to flourish

content.content: 彼は世に時めいている
He has his day―He is seeing his best days.
一時は世に時めいたこともある
He has had his day―He has seen his best days―He has seen better days.
世にときめく人
a man seeing his best days

content:
どぎも〔度胆〕
〈名〉Courage

content.content: 度胆を抜く
to appall one
度胆を抜かれる
to be appalled
度胆を抜くような光景だ
It is an appalling sight.

ときもの〔解き物〕
〈名〉Old clothes to be unsewn:(=する) to unsew old clothes

content:
とぎゅう〔屠牛〕
〈名〉Slaughtering cattle

content.content: 屠牛者
a butcher
屠牛所
a slaughter-house―a butchery
屠牛業
butchery (business or trade)

どきゅうかん〔弩級艦〕
〈名〉A dreadnought

content:
とぎょ〔渡御〕
〈名〉An Imperial progress

content.content: 聖上青山離宮へ渡御あらせらる
The Emperor proceeded to the Aoyama Detached Palace.

content:
どきょう〔度胸〕
〈名〉Courage; pluck; heart; nerve; self-confidence

content.content: 好い度胸だ
You are a plucky fellow―Your are a brave fellow.
彼は度胸が無い
He is wanting in courage.
度胸を定める、度胸をすえる
to brace one's nerve―nerve one's heart―nerve oneself
度胸を定めて返答しろ
Nerve yourself for an answer!
万一のことがあっても度胸をすえている
I am prepared for the worst.
度胸がすわる
to gain self-confidence
腕に覚えがあれば自然度胸がすわる
If one is conscious of one's powers, one will naturally gain confidence.
彼は度胸がすわっている
He has strong nerves―iron nerves―splendid courage.
度胸を試す
to test one's nerve
度胸を試してやったのだ
I put his nerve to the test―put his courage to the test.
舞台度胸
confidence on the stage

content:
ときよじせつ〔時世時節〕
〈名〉The times

content.content: 時世時節と諦めしゃんせ
Take the times as they are!
時世時節と諦めました
I take the times as I find them.
こうなるのも時世時節だ
I must conform to the times.

content:
とぎれ〔途切れ〕
〈名〉A break; a pause; intermission; interruption:(=る) to break; to pause; to intermit; to be interrupted

content.content: 話がちょっと途切れた
There was a break―a pause―in the talk.
往来がちょっと途切れた
The traffic was interrupted for a while.
脈が途切れ途切れに打つ
The pulse intermits―There are intermissions in the pulse.
途切れ途切れに歌う
to sing by snatches
途切れ途切れにものを言う
to chop one's words―chop one's sentences―speak disconnectedly
途切れた
(話)broken talk―(往来)―interrupted traffic―(言葉)―disconnected speech―(脈)―intermittent pulse

ときわかきわ〔常磐堅磐〕
〈形〉Everlasting; eternal

ときわぎ〔常磐木〕
〈名〉An evergreen

ときん〔鍍金〕
〈名〉Gilt; plating:(=する) to gilt; to plate:(=せる) gilt; plated

content:
とく〔解く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=ほどく)to untie (a string) ; to unbind (a prisoner) ; to undo (a knot) ; to loose, loosen, unloose (a fastening) ; to disentangle (thread) ; to unravel (a stocking, etc.)

content.content: 結び目を解く
to undo a knot―untie a knot―loose a fastening―unknot a string
紐を解く
to undo a string―untie a string
靴の紐を解く
to untie the lace―unlace the boots
包みを解く
to undo a bundle
帯を解く
to undo one's girdle―ungird oneself
縄を解く
to unfasten a rope―(戒めの縄なら)―unbind a prisoner―release a prisoner
(女が)髪を解く
to undo one's hair
着物を解く
to unsew a garment
縫い目を解く
to unstitch the seam
馬を解く
to unhitch a horse
もつれを解く
to disentangle―unravel

content: 2. (=分解する)to disjoint (a machine) ; to take (a clock) to pieces

content.content: 銃を解く
to take a gun to pieces
この銃は解きやすい
This gun takes to pieces easily.

content: 3. (=解決する)to solve (a problem) ; to answer (a puzzle) ; to work out (a problem)

content.content: 問題を解く
to solve a problem―work out a problem―answer a problem
今問題を解いている
I am working the problem.
問題が解けた
I have solved the problem.
謎を解く
to solve a puzzle―answer a puzzle
この謎が解けるか
Can you solve my riddle?―answer my puzzle?
方程式を解く
to solve an equation
暗号を解く
to decipher a code
葛藤を解く
to put an end to trouble

content: 4. (=氷解する)to resolve, clear, dispel (a doubt) ; to clear up (a mystery) ; to enlighten (one on a doubtful point)

content.content: 疑いを解く
to resolve one's doubts―clear a doubt―dispel all doubts
どうぞこの疑わしい点を解いて下さい
Please enlighten me on this doubtful point.
秘密を解く
to clear up a mystery
人の誤解を解く、迷いを解く
to clear one's misunderstanding―undeceive one―open one's eyes
双方の誤解を解く
to clear the misunderstanding between the two

content: 5. (=解除する)to dissolve, cancel, rescind (a contract); to remove (a prohibition); to lift (the ban) ; to withdraw (a warning) ; to release, disengage (one from a promise) ; to absolve (one from a vow) ; to discharge, dispense (one from obligations)

content.content: 契約を解く
to dissolve a contract―cancel a contract―rescind a contract
約束を解く
to release one from one's promise―disengage one from one's promise
誓いを解く
to absolve one from a vow
義務を解く
to discharge one from obligations―dispense one from obligations
禁を解く
to lift the ban―remove the prohibition―cancel the interdict
囲みを解く、囲みを解かしむ
to raise the siege
封港を解く、封港を解かしむ
to raise the blockade
武装を解く
(船なら)to disarm a ship―(砲台なら)―dismantle a fort
交通遮断を解く
to remove the taboo―lift the quarantine
警戒を解く
to withdraw a warning
戒厳令を解く
to repeal the martial law
隊を解く
to disband a corps―disband the troops

content: 6. (=免ずる)to relieve (one of one's office)

content.content: 彼は職を解かれた
He has been relieved of his office.
雇いを解く
to cancel an engagement―discharge an employ? from one's service―dispense with one's services

content: 7. (=和げる)to appease

content.content: 人の怒りを解く
to appease one's anger
不和を解く
to heal the breach
顎を解く
to laugh one's jaws out of joint

content:
とく〔疾く〕
〈副〉Rapidly; swiftly; fast

content.content: 疾く走る
to run fast―run swiftly

content:
とく〔夙く〕
〈副〉Soon; early; at once

content.content: 夙く参れ
Go at once!

content:
とく〔説く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=説明する)to explain (the meaning) ; to expound (a doctrine) ; to make (the matter) clear

content.content: 彼にいくら説いて聞かしてもわからない
I can not make the matter clear to him.
意味を説く
to explain the meaning
詳しく説く、具さに説く
to explain at length―explain at large
ざっと説く
to explain roughly―explain briefly
Plato は霊魂不死の理を説く
Plato expounds the philosophy of the immortality of the soul.

content: 2. (=解釈する)to interpret (a passage)

content.content: ここは二様に説ける
The passage may be interpreted in two ways.
いろいろに説ける
It may be interpreted in various ways.
文字通りに説く
to interpret according to the letter
聖書は各自の知識次第に説く
Each interprets the Bible according to his or her lights.

content: 3. (=説得する)to persuade, prevail upon (one to do something) ; to reason (with one―one into or out of anything) ; to talk (one into or out of doing something)

content.content: 彼に説いて承知さした
I have persuaded him to do so―reasoned him into compliance.
彼にいくら説いても承知しない
I can not prevail upon him to do so―He is not to be prevailed upon.
人に道理を説く
to reason with one
彼の非を説いた
I reasoned with him on his mistake―remonstrated with him on his error.
彼に非を説いて止めさした
I reasoned him out of the step―dissuaded him from doing so.
彼に非を説いてその女と結婚することを思いとどまらした
I have reasoned him out of marriage―dissuaded him from marrying the girl.
彼にいくら説いても決心を翻さぬ
I can not talk him out of his resolution―reason him out of his resolution.
彼女にいろいろ説いて心配させないようにした
I reasoned her out of her fears.
彼をしきりに説いて勉強させた
I talked him into working hard―urged him to work hard.
誤りを説いてやったら納得して帰った
I pointed out his error, and he went away convinced.

content: 4. (=説教する)to preach; to expound

content.content: 教えを説く
to preach a doctrine―expound a doctrine
道を説く
to preach the truth
孔子の道を説く
to preach Confucianism―expound the doctrine of Confucius
先生は諄々として道を説いた
He inculcated the truth upon me.
道徳を説く
to expound the laws of morality
節制は説く者を多く行う者少し
Many preach temperance, but few practise it.
法を説く
to preach Buddhism
人を見て法を説く
Suit your style to your audience―Adapt yourself to the intelligence of your audience―“Be all things to all men.”
必要を説く
to urge (on one) the necessity of something―impress upon one the importance of something
彼はしきりに経済の必要を説く
He urges the necessity of economy―insists upon economy.
先生はしきりに系統的研究の必要を説かれる
He impresses upon us the importance of systematic study.

content: 5. (=唱道する)to advocate; to advance; to set forth

content.content: 新説を説く
to advocate a new doctrine―advance a new doctrine―set forth a new doctrine―broach a new doctrine
民主主義を説く
to advocate democracy―espouse the cause of democracy

content:
とく〔得〕
〈名〉Profit; gain; advantage; interest; benefit:(evil に対し)good:(=な) profitable; advantageous; beneficial

content.content: 得な
(商売)profitable trade―(条件)―advantageous terms―(地位)―a beneficial position
得をする
to profit―benefit―(儲かるの意味なら)―gain―be the gainer―come off a gainer
得になる
to prove to one's advantage―turn out to one's profit―make for one's interests
そうした方が君の得になる
It will be to your advantage―to your profit―to your interest―to do so.
買った方が得だ
It will be to your advantage―advantageous to you―to buy it.
売った方が得だ
It will be to your profit―profitable to you―to sell it.
黙っていた方が得だ
It will be (to) your interest to remain silent.
どっちへ転んでも得だ
In either case, you will come off a gainer.
古手で買った方が得だ
It will be more advantageous―It will pay better―to buy at second hand.
この取引は得にはならぬ
This transaction will not prove to your advantage―It will be to your disadvantage to engage in this transaction.
そんな議論は君の得にはならぬ
Such arguments do not make for your interests―Such arguments make against your interests.
そんなことをしては君の得にはならぬ
You are not acting for your interests―You are acting against your interests.
この仕事に得が無い
The work is not profitable―There is no money in the work―The work does not pay.
一文残せば一文の得
“A penny saved is a penny gained.”
古手で買った方が十円得だ
You will gain ten yen―save ten yen―by buying at second hand.
近道を行った方が一マイル得だ
You will gain a mile―save a mile―by taking the short cut.
覚えただけ得だ
I am the better for learning it.
君は働いただけ得だ
You are the better for working.
君は得な身だ
You enjoy many advantages.
それでも僕には一つ君より得なことがある
But I have one advantage over you.
貧乏な家に生まれる方がかえって得だ
It is a positive advantage to be born poor.
美しく生まれる人は得だ
It is an advantage to be born beautiful.
君は得な性分だ
You are favoured by nature―Nature's favourite.
朝起き三文の得
“The early bird catches the worm.”
一得一失
Where there is good, there is evil―Every good has its evil―Every advantage has its disadvantage―If anything gains in one respect, it loses in another.
一方に損をする者があれば一方に得をする者がある
“It is an ill wind that blows nobody good.”
損して得取れ
Make the best of a bad bargain.
延引すればするだけこちらの得、長引けば長引いただけ先方の損
Time is in our favour―Time is against the other party.
取れば取り得
What you take, is so much gain.
死ねば死に損、生きれば生き得
To die is so much lost; to live is so much gained.
打ち得、打たれ損
One strikes with impunity; the other is struck without redress.

content:
とく〔徳〕
〈名〉
1. (=一般の徳) Virtue; goodness; moral excellence

content.content: 徳を具える
to possess virtue
彼は徳を具えている
He is good―virtuous―possessed of virtue―adorned with virtues.
徳の高い人だ
He is a virtuous man―a man of virtue―a man of high moral character.
人はどれほど才が有っても徳が無ければ往々小人に終る
A man may be as clever as you will, and yet, if he is not good, he may be a paltry fellow.
智ある者は往々徳を欠く
Men of genius are often wanting in virtue.
徳を行う
to practise virtue―be good
幸福ならんと欲せば徳を行え
If you would be happy, be good.
徳を積む、徳を磨く
to strive after virtue―do good
智を磨き徳を積む
Seek truth and do good.
徳を養う
to cultivate virtue
徳を養い義を重んず
Be virtuous and honourable.
徳を修める
to cultivate moral excellence
徳を樹てる
to perform virtuous deeds
皇神皇宗徳を樹つること深厚なり
Our Imperial ancestors laid deep foundations of virtue.
徳を楽しむ
to delight in virtue―practise virtue for virtue's sake
四民徳に服す
The people were won over by his goodness―His goodness attached the people to him.
民はその徳に感じた
The people were influenced by his virtue―The influence of his virtue worked upon the people.
徳は孤ならず必ず隣あり
Virtue attracts.

content: 2. (=一種の徳)a virtue; a quality; a good quality; a mental grace; a grace of character

content.content: 彼は美徳を具えている
He possesses mental graces―graces of character.
あまた徳の有る中にこっけいの徳をも具えている
Among other qualities, he possesses that of humour.
仁義の徳
the virtues of humanity and justice
文武の徳
civil and military virtues
王侯の徳
princely virtues
人に王侯たる者の持つべきものは徳なる哉
How requisite princely virtues are to a ruler of men!
人の徳を表彰する
to publish a man's virtues

content: 3. (=人を敬服させる力)the power of commanding love and respect

content.content: 彼は徳の有る人だ
He commands love and respect.

content: 4. (=お蔭)indebtedness

content.content: 彼は些細な功を徳とする
He is grateful for trifling services.

content:
とく〔溶く〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: とかす〔溶かす〕
絵具を溶く
to dissolve colours

とく〔梳く〕
〈他動〉To comb (the hair)

content:
とぐ〔研ぐ〕
〈他動〉
1. To whet; to grind; to hone; to strop; to scour; to sharpen

content.content: 刀を研ぐ
to sharpen a sword
小刀を研ぐ
to whet a knife
庖丁を研ぐ
to scour a knife
斧を研ぐ
to grind an axe
剃刀を研ぐ
to hone a razor―(は油砥。革砥でなら)―strop a razor

content: 2. (=磨く)to polish; to burnish

content.content: 刀を研ぎ澄ます
to burnish a sword
米を研ぐ
to wash rice (preparatory to boiling it)
猫が爪を研ぐ
A cat sharpens her claws―scratches on a post.

content:
どく〔退く〕
〈自動〉To get out of the way; to make way for (some one)

content.content: 邪魔だからそこどけ
Get out of my way!
自動車が来たからどけ
Get out of the way of the motor-car.
一行がお通りだからどけ
Make way for the party!
(競走が始まるから)皆どけて路をあけよ
Clear the track!

content:
どく〔得〕
〈接尾詞〉(=何々し得)So much gain

content.content: 見れば見得だ
If you see, it is so much gained.

content:
どく〔毒〕
〈名〉
1. Poison:(毒蛇などの毒)venom:(病毒)virus:(=の) poisonous; poisoned; venomous; envenomed

content.content: 毒を仰ぐ
to take poison
毒を仰いで自殺する
to poison oneself
毒を盛る
to administer poison
酒に毒を入れる
to poison wine―drug wine
毒の入った酒
poisoned wine―drugged wine
井戸に毒を投ずる
to poison a well
鼠に毒を食わせる
to poison a mouse
毒にあたる
to be poisoned
毒を消す
to neutralize poison―counteract poison
毒をもって毒を制す
to neutralize poison with poison―“Like cures like”
毒がまわる
Poison takes effect.
毒が吹き出る
Poison breaks out in sores.
(身体の)毒を下す
to purge (the system from) virus
身体の毒が出る
The system works out the virus.
庖丁の片側だけに毒が塗ってあった
The knife was anointed on one side only.
あの人の言葉に毒がある
He uses envenomed language.
毒を食わば皿までも
“In for a penny, in for a pound”―“Over shoes over boots”―I will “go the whole hog.”
甲の薬は乙の毒
“One man's meat is another man's poison.”
毒のある蛇、毒の無い蛇
a venomous snake―an innocuous snake

content: 2. (=毒になるの毒)(to do one) harm:(=な) bad for the health; harmful to health; injurious to health; detrimental to health

content.content: 酒は毒だ
Wine will do you harm―Wine is bad for the health―Wine is injurious to health―detrimental to health.
小量の酒は毒にはならぬかえって薬だ
A little wine will do you more good than harm.
夜更かしは身体の毒だ
Late hours are bad for the health.
目の毒
an eyesore
薄暗がりの読書は目に毒だ
Reading in the twilight is bad for the eyes.
見るは目に毒
The sight engenders the desire of possession.
甘い物は胃に毒だ
Sweets are bad for the stomach.
金は身の毒
Money will do you harm―bring you evil.
毒にも薬にも成らぬ
It does neither good nor harm―One has nothing to hope nor fear from it.

content: 3. (=梅毒)syphilis

content.content: 身体に毒がある
He has a syphilitic body―inherited syphilis.
君は毒を受けたことがあるか
Did you ever catch syphilis?
毒が吹き出る
Syphilis breaks out.

content:
どくあんない〔独案内〕
〈名〉(教科書の独案内)a crib; a cab:(米国では)a pony

content.content: 独案内を使う
to cab―crib
英語独案内
English without a master―English self-taught.
法律独案内
Every man his own lawyer.

content:
とくい〔得意〕
〈名〉
1. (=繁栄)prosperity

content.content: 得意時代
one's bright days―one's palmy days―one's best days
彼は今が最も得意時代だ
He is seeing his best days―at the summit of his prosperity―at the zenith of his fortune―at the top of Fortune's wheel.
彼は得意時代が過ぎた
He has seen his best days―He is past the summit of his prosperity―His reign is over.

content: 2. (=自慢)pride; triumph; elation

content.content: 得意がる
to pride oneself on―plume oneself on―peacock oneself on―pique oneself on―value oneself on―anything
彼は英語が得意だからおかしい
He prides himself on his English.
芸を得意がっている
He plumes himself on his accomplishments.
彼は得意然としている
He is triumphant.
彼は得意然としてそう言った
He said so triumphantly.
彼は得意になって功名話をする
He brags triumphantly of his deeds.
その得意思うべし、その得意察すべし
His triumph may be imagined.
彼は成功して得意になっている
He is elated with success―Success has turned his head.
大得意だ
He is triumphant―as happy as a king―satisfied with himself and the world―in all his glory.
彼は大得意で帰って来た
He returned in triumph.
得意満面だ
He has a triumphant air―Pride is written in every line of his countenance―His face is beaming with pride.
得意満面で、得意顔で入って来た
He entered with a triumphant air―with a triumphant look―with a triumphant countenance.
彼女は得意さの余り黙っていられなかった
She could not, in the pride of her heart, contain herself.
得意の鼻をうごめかす
to look proud―look triumphant

content: 3. (=得手)one's strong point; one's forte:(=な) favourite; pet

content.content: 彼は英語が得意だ
He is strong in English―in his element in English―English is his forte―English is in his line.
彼は文学談をさせると得意だ
He is in his element when he discourses on literature―Literature is his favourite topic.
日本軍は山間の戦闘が得意だ
The Japanese are in their element among the hills.
彼は今の仕事が得意だ
He is in his element―His present work is in his line.
君は今の仕事は不得意だからもっと得意な仕事をするがよい
Your present work is out of your line; you had better do something more in your line.
彼はこういうことが得意だ
He is now in his element―Such things are in his line.
こういうことが一番得意だ
He is at his best in such things―Such things are his forte.
彼は何が一番得意か
What is he at his best in?―What is his forte?
英語が一番得意だと言っている
He says English is his forte.
得意の問題
one's favourite topic
得意の説
one's pet theory
得意の作
one's pet and darling work
得意の壇場
one's favourite ground―one's own ground
専門家の得意の壇場で専門家を負かす
to beat a professional on his own ground
誰でも得意なことをさせておけば偉い
Everybody is strong on his own ground.
得意の策を弄する
to resort to one's favourite trick
おのおの得意の技能を揮るう
Each displays his favourite art.

content: 4. (=顧客)a regular customer; a patron; a client:(集合的に言えば)clientele; custom; connection

content.content: あの店は好い得意がある
The business has a good custom―a good connection.
得意が多い
They have a large custom―a large connection.
支那に得意が多い
They have a large connection in China.
得意にする
(客の方から言うと)to give one custom―patronize a shop―(店の方から言うと)―have some people for customers―enjoy the custom of some people―be patronized by some people.
安く売れば得意にしてやる
If you sell cheap, you shall have my custom.

content.content: これは別に特徴の無い本だ

彼の行動の特徴は迅速なことである

彼の文章の特徴は意味の明瞭なことである

to be sentenced to penal servitude

penal servitude for a term
無期徒刑
penal servitude for life
徒刑囚
a convict

content:
どげざする〔土下座する〕
〈自動〉To kneel on the ground (in token of abject submission)

content.content: 土下座して謝まった
He knelt in the dust in token of submission.

とけつ〔吐血〕
〈名〉Spitting of blood; haemoptysis:(=する) to spit blood; to vomit blood; to cough up blood

とげつほう〔吐月峯〕

content:
とける〔解ける〕
〈自動〉
1. (=ほどける)to get loose; too come untied; to come undone

content.content: 結び目が解ける
A knot comes untied―comes undone.
帯が解けた
My girdle is loose.
怒りが解ける
to relent towards one
彼の怒りがまだ解けない
He has not relented towards me yet.
どうして怒りが解けないかしら
I wonder why his soul is still dark against me.
君の方からそう下から出たら先の心も解けるだろう
If you humble yourself so far, he will relent.
疑いが解ける
Doubt is solved―Doubt is resolved―Doubt is dispelled―Doubt is satisfied.
ご講義を承って疑問が全く解けました
On hearing your lecture, my doubts have all been resolved―my doubts have all been dispelled―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your lecture has resolved all my doubts―dispelled all my doubts―satisfied all my doubts.
やっと謎が解けた
At last I have solved the puzzle.
葛藤が解けたか
Is the trouble over?
葛藤未だ解けず
The trouble still continues.

content:
とける〔溶ける〕
〈自動〉To melt; to dissolve:(霜などは)to thaw

content.content: 寒国では雪が溶けるといろいろの花が一時に咲き出す
In cold countries, when the snow melts,―when the snow thaws,―various flowers begin to bloom at once.
霜が溶け出した
It is beginning to thaw.
蝋は熱で溶ける
Wax melts with heat.
塩は水に溶ける
Salt dissolves in water.
海水にはさまざまの塩類が溶けて含まれている
Sea-water holds many salts in solution.
口へ入れると溶けるようだ
It melts in the mouth.
溶けやすい、溶け難い
to be soluble―insoluble

content:
とける〔鎔ける〕
〈自動〉To melt; to fuse

content.content: 金属は火で鎔ける
Metals melt in the fire―Metals are fused by the fire.
鎔けて交じる
to melt into each other
鎔けて一つになる
to fuse into one
鎔けやすい、鎔け難い
to be fusible―infusible

content:
とげる〔遂げる〕
〈他動〉To accomplish, effect (one's purpose) ; to attain (one's object) ; to gain (one's end) ; to realize (one's hopes) ; to achieve (a success) ; to make good (one's escape) ; to go through (an undertaking) ; to carry (a matter) through ; a put (a matter) through ; to bring (a matter) to a successful issue

content.content: 目的を遂げる、志を遂げる
to accomplish one's purpose―effect one's purpose
どんなことをしても目的を遂げる
I will accomplish my purpose at any cost―Nothing shall hinder me from accomplishing my purpose.
彼は目的を遂げかねた
He failed to accomplish his purpose―stopped short of his goal.
希望を遂げる、望みを遂げる
to realize one's hopes―realize one's wishes―obtain one's desire―have one's wish
本望を遂げる
to attain one's object―realize the desire of one's heart
大望を遂げる
to attain the object of one's ambition
本懐を遂げる、宿志を遂げる
to attain one's cherished object
思いを遂げた
(男なら)He had his will of her―(女なら)―She succeeded in love
妥協を遂げる
to effect a compromise
敵国に上陸を遂げる
to effect a landing―make good a landing―in enemy territory
大成功を遂げる
to achieve a triumph
名を遂げる
to win fame―win renown
功成り名遂げて身退くは天の道なり
To succeed, win fame, and then to retire from life, is the way of Heaven.
最期を遂げる
to meet one's death―meet one's end―meet one's fate
潔く最期を遂げた
He met his death like a man.
非命の死を遂げる
to die an untimely death―come to an untimely end
花々しく戦死を遂げた
He died a glorious death in battle.
情死を遂げる
to commit a double suicide
自殺を遂げる
to commit suicide

content:
どける〔退ける〕
〈他動〉To remove; to get (anything) out of the way

content.content: 邪魔物をどける
to remove the obstacles―get the obstacles out of the way
この卓が邪魔だからどけろ
Get this table out of the way.

content:
とこ
〈名〉→『

content.content: ところ〔所、処〕
僕んとこ
my home
君んとこの猫
your cat
好いとこを見せて下さい
Show me some good ones.
中位のとこが好い
I want a middling one.
今行くとこだ
I am going―(そちらへなら)―I am coming.

content:
とこ〔床〕
〈名〉
1. (=寝床)a bed:(夜具の意味なら)bedding

content.content: 床を取る、床を敷く、床をのべる
to make a bed―prepare a bed
どこへお床を取りましょうか
Where shall I make your bed?
床を上げる
to put away the bedding
床をたたむ
to fold up the bedding
床に就く
to go to bed―retire to repose―turn in
彼は床に就いている
He is in bed.
床に入る
to get into bed
床を離れる
to get out of bed
床の中へ這い込む
to creep into bed
床から飛び起きる
to jump out of bed
床の中でタバコを飲む
to smoke in bed
床の中で読書するのは悪い癖だ
Reading in bed is a bad habit.
子どもが床を濡らす
A child wets the bed.

content: 2. (=病床)a sick-bed

content.content: 病の床に就く
to take to one's bed
床に就いてから一月になる
It is a month since he took to his bed.
病の床に臥す
to lie on a bed of illness―to be laid on a bed of illness
彼は病の床に臥している、病の床に就いている
He is ill abed―confined to his bed―laid up with an illness―laid on his back―laid by the heels―He must keep his bed.
風邪を引いて床に就いている
He is laid up with a cold.
リウマチが起こって床に就いている
He is laid up with an attack of rheumatism.
(病人が)床を上げる
to leave one's sick-bed
(病人が)床を離れる
to rise from a sick-bed
病人が床を離れて歩けるようになった
The invalid can get about―The invalid is up and about.
病人は床を離れることができぬ、床に就ききりだ
He is bedridden.

content:
3. (=苗の床)a bed; a nursery
4. (=畳の床)padding
5. (=河の底)a river-bed
6. (=床{ゆか})the floor
7. (=床の間)an alcove
8. (=床場)a barber's shop

どこ〔何処〕
〈疑問副詞〉
1. Where?; What place?; What country?; What part of the country?

content.content: 君はどこに居るか
Where do you live?
あの人は国はどこか
What part of the country does he come from?
君が探すのはどこか
What is the place you want?
彼は今頃はどこにどうしていることやら
I wonder where he is now?
どこへ
Where?―(古文体では)―Whither?
どこへ行くか
Where are you going?―(古文体では)―Whither goest thou?
彼はどこへ行ったか
Where has he gone?
彼はどこへ行くと言ったか
Where did he say he was going?
彼はどこへ行くとか言ったか(言わぬか)
Did he say where he was going?
どこから
From where?―(古文体では)―(From) whence?
君はどこから来たのか
Where did you come from?―(古文体では)―Whence comest thou?
どこまで〔何処まで〕

content:
』
5. (…せよ、とも、ても、とて) wherever

content.content: どこへ行ったとて辛抱が無くては駄目だ
Wherever you may go,―No matter where you may go,―Go where you will,―you can not get on without perseverance.
どこへおいでになってもそう安くは買われません
Wherever you may go, you can not have it so cheap.

content:
6. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: あれはどこの人か
Who is he?
その手紙はどこから来たのか
Whom is the letter from?
そんなことをする奴がどこの世界にあるものか
Who ever heard of a man doing such a thing?
泥棒はどこから入ったか
How did the burglar get in?
その本はどこの本屋にもある(どこの本屋にも無い)
The book is (not) to be had at any bookseller's.
僕の処置はどこが悪いか
How have I done wrong?
僕の処置はどこが悪いかしら
I wonder how I can have done wrong.
僕の処置はどこが悪いかしらとあやしんだ
I wondered how I could have done wrong.
この文はどこが悪いか
What is wrong with this sentence?
私の答案はどこが間違っていますか
What is wrong with my answer?
あの人はどこが好いか
What (good) do you see in him?
どこが好いかというその人にどこが悪いと問い返す
She asked me what I saw in him, and I asked back what was wrong with him.
あの先生はどこが違うとてあのようにもてはやされるのか
What is there about him, that he should be made so much of?
その話はどこが面白いか
What is there interesting about that story?
あの人はどこがおかしいか
What is there strange about that man?
彼はどこを探してもいません
He is nowhere to be seen.
どこをどう歩いて来たかわからない
I don't know how I got here.
どこをどうすればよいかわからない
I don't know how to use it.
彼はどこからどこまでも武士だ
He is every inch a samurai―He is a samurai, every inch of him.
どこを押せばあんな音が出るやら
He says things foreign to his heart.
どこを風が吹くかというようなふうをしている
He has an air of perfect indifference.
どこの馬の骨やら
He is God knows who―(女なら)―She is no better than she ought to be.
どこのいずくに果てるやら
They will die in a ditch.
始めの意気込みどこへやら
His initial ardour has evaporated.

十五日に米国へ渡航致します
I leave for―sail for―America on the 15th.
渡航中は海上平穏であった

渡航中海が荒れた

彼は渡航中病気になって着港するや否や死んだ

船賃代りに労働して渡航する

Watch o'er my sacred land,

content:
とこづく〔床就く〕
〈自動〉To take to one's bed

content.content: 彼が床就いてから月余になる
It is over a month since he took to his bed.
彼は病気で床就いている
He is ill abed―confined to his bed―laid up with an illness―laid on his back―laid by the heels―He must keep his bed.
風邪を引いて床就いている
He is laid up with a cold.
リウマチが起こって床就いている
He is laid up with an attack of rheumatism.
病人は長く床就いている
He is bedridden.

content:
どこでも〔何処でも〕
〈不定副詞〉
1. (=どこでも勝手)anywhere

content.content: どこへでも行くがよい
You may go anywhere.
この本はどこの本屋にでもある
This book is to be had anywhere―at any bookseller's.
どこでもよい
Any place will do.
どこでもかまわぬ
I don't care where―It does not matter where.
どこでも好いから田舎へ転地するがよい
You ought to go into the country for change of air, no matter where―any place will do.

content: 2. (=どこでも皆)everywhere

content.content: あの人はどこでも行かぬところ(国)は無い
He has been everywhere―in every country.
この本はどこの学校でも使っている
This book is used everywhere―in every school.

content: 〈接続副詞〉Wherever

content.content: どこでも好きなところへ行くがよい
You may go wherever you like.
どこでも好きなところへおすわり
Sit wherever you like.
この犬はどこへでも僕の行くところへついて来る
My dog will follow me wherever I go.

content:
どこどこ〔何処何処〕
〈疑問副詞〉Where?; What places?

content.content: どこどこへ寄って来たか
What houses have you called at?

content:
どことなく〔何処となく〕
〈副〉Vaguely; indefinitely

content.content: どことなく身体が悪い
I have an indefinite sense of illness.
どことなく世間が騒がしい
There is a vague sense of alarm among the people.

content:
どこともなく〔何処ともなく〕
〈副〉No one knows where

content.content: 彼はどこともなく逃げ去った
He has escaped nobody knows where―God knows where.

とこなつ〔常夏〕
〈名〉The wild pink

content:

〈否定副詞〉Nowhere ［not anywhere］

content.content: 彼は(いくら探しても)どこにもいません
He is nowhere to be seen.
この本はどこの本屋にもありません
The book is not to be had anywhere―at any bookseller's.

content: 〈不定副詞〉Anywhere; everywhere

content.content: この本はどこの本屋にもある
This book is to be had anywhere―at any bookseller's.
そんな人はどこの国にもある
Such men are to be found everywhere―in every country.

content:

content.content: 床の間付きの座敷
a room with an alcove
床の間の置き物
an ornament for the alcove
床の間に花が生けてある

content.content: 君は床離れが悪い

content:
どこまで〔何処まで〕
〈疑問副詞〉How far?; To what extent?

content.content: どこまで行ったか
How far did you go?
火事はどこまで広がったか
How far did the fire spread?
この前はどこまで読みましたか
Where did we leave off last time?
評判はどこまで本当だかわからない
We can't say to what extent the report is true.
彼はどこまでばかだかわからない
There is no saying how far his folly may go―Nobody knows the extent of his folly―His folly knows no bounds.
彼はどこまで慾が深いかわからない
His avarice knows no bounds.
どこまで図々しいかわからない
His impudence knows no bounds.
どこまでずるいかわからない
His cunning knows no bounds.
とんぼ釣り
Thou catcher of the dragon-fly!
今日はどこまで行ったやら
How far canst thou have gone today?

content:
どこまでも〔何処までも〕
〈不定副詞〉
1. (=どこへでも)anywhere; to the end of the world

content.content: お前とならばどこまでも
I would go to the world's end in your company.

content: 2. (=何の点から見ても)in all respects; in every point

content.content: 彼はどこからどこまでも古武士だ
He is every inch an old samurai―He is an old samurai, every inch of him.
どこからどこまでも才子だ
He is clever to the tips of his finger-ends.
どこまでも日本人だ
He is a Japanese to the backbone.
どこまでも軍人にできている
He is every way cut out for a soldier.

content: 3. (=強情にも)persistently

content.content: 強情にも彼はどこまでも知らぬ知らぬと言い張っている
He persists in denying his knowledge.
どこまでも身に覚えは無いと言い張っている
He persists in asserting his innocence.
この事はどこまでも主張する
I would assert it at the stake.

とこみせ〔床店〕
〈名〉A stall; a booth

content:
どこも〔何処も〕

content.content: どこへも行きません

どこも行く当てが無い
I have nowhere to go―I do not know where to go―I have all the world before me.

content: 〈不定副詞〉Everywhere

content.content: 暑中はどこも商売が暇だ
Trade is dull everywhere in summer.

content: 〈転意〉

content.content: あの人は付き合ってみたところではどこも変ったところは無い
From what I have seen of him, there is nothing peculiar about him.
二人はどこも似たところは無い
They have nothing in common with each other.

〈不定副詞〉Everywhere; anywhere and everywhere

content:
ところ〔所、処〕
〈名〉
1. (=場所)a place:(狭い処)a spot:(出来事のありし処)a scene:(建物のある処)a site:(人や物の入る処)room

content.content: 仙台はどんな処か
What sort of a place is Sendai?
眠むたい処だ
It is a dull place.
僕の生まれた処だ
It is the place where I was born.
ここは昔戦いのあった処だ
This is the scene of a battle.
実物の隠してある処を知っているか
Do you know the place where the treasure is buried?
処をくわしく知っている
I know the exact spot.
ここは若い者を置く処じゃない
This is no place for a young man.
どんな物でもそれぞれ用い処がある
Everything is useful in its place.
どんな人でもそれぞれ用い処がある
Everyman is useful in his way.
所を得る
to be in one's place―in one's element
彼は所を得ぬ
He is out of his place―out of his element―a square peg in a round hole―a fish out of water.
僕の入る処があるか
Is there room for me?
もう入る処が無い
There is no room for more.
いま一人だけ入る処がある
There is room for one more.
ここが今度の学校の建つ処だ
This is the site of the new school.
ここは昔城があった処だ
This is the site of an old castle.
痛い処へ触れる
to touch one on a sore spot
彼は処嫌わずにしゃれる
He is witty in place and out of place―in season and out of season.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 出物腫れ物所嫌わず
“Necessity knows no law.”
こんな所へ来るんじゃなかった
I should have known better than to have come here.
そんな所に何をしているか
What are you doing there?
あんな所へ誰が行くものか
Who would think of going there?
呼んだら聞こえる所におれ
Stay within hearing!
彼は波の音の聞こえる所に居る
He lives within hearing of the sea.
船は陸の見える所へ来た
We came in sight of land.
敵艦は大砲の届く所へ来た
The enemy ship came within range.
石を投げたら届く所にある
It is within a stone's throw.
所変われば品変わる
“Each country has its own customs.”

content: 2. (=住所)(one's) place, house, address

content.content: 君の今度の処は家賃はいくらか
What do you pay for your new place?
その人の処がわかっているか
Do you know his address?
所がわかっていたら手紙をやるのだが
If I knew his address, I would write to him.
所を教えてくれなかった
He did not give his address.
僕の今度の所を君に知らせたかね
Did I tell you my new address?
所も知らぬ名も知らぬ
I don't know his name or address.
所も知らぬ名も知らぬお方
a stranger
僕は伯(叔)父の所にいる
I live with my uncle.
所書き
one's address

content: 3. (=箇所)a passage

content.content: ここは面白いところだ
This is an interesting passage.
僕はこの本の好いところを暗記している
I know the fine passages by heart.
むずかしいところを飛ばして読んだ
I skipped over the hard passages.

content: 4. (=点)a point

content.content: この二つは似たところがある
There are some points of resemblance between the two.
違うところも有る
There are some points of difference between them.
君と僕は見るところが違う
We look at the matter from different points of view.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 女の子のくせに少しも柔和なところが無い
Though a girl, there is nothing gentle about her.
あの人はどこか軍人らしいところがある
He has something of the soldier about him.
少しも学者らしいところが無い
He has nothing of the scholar in him.
彼の言うことには尤もらしいところがある
There is something plausible―a show of sense―in what he says.
そこがこの遊びの面白いところだ
That's the beauty of the game.

content: 5. (=特徴)a feature

content.content: この本は別に変わったところは無い
The book has no distinct features.
あの人は別に変わったところは無い
There is nothing peculiar about him.

content: 6. (=時)a time

content.content: ぐずぐずしているところでない
This is no time for shilly-shallying.
ここは内輪げんかをしているところじゃない
This is no time for quarrelling among ourselves.
僕は出かけようと思っているところへ人に来られた
I had a man come at a time when I was about to go out.
君はちょうど好いところへ来た
You are just in time―in the nick of time.
彼が食事をしているところへ行った
I found him at dinner.
彼は僕が朝飯を食っているところへ来た
He came when I was at breakfast.
彼は悪いところへ来た
He came at an unseasonable moment―at an inopportune moment.

content: 〈関係代名詞〉(=ところのもの)what

content.content: ここは著者の大いに苦心したところだ
This is what cost the author much labour.
それは吾人の悦ぶところだ
That is what we rejoice at.
それは僕の憂うるところだ
That is what I am troubled about.
それは皆の歎くところだ
That is what everybody grieves at.
君の言うところ正にしかり
What you say, in true―Your statement is just.
彼の言うところによればだいぶ苦労したらしい
According to what he says,―According to his account,―he seems to have gone through much.
僕の聞くところではなかなか偉い人らしい
From what I hear, he seems to be quite a great man.
彼と付き合ってみたところでは別に変わったところも無いようだ
From what I have seen of him, there seems to be nothing peculiar about him.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 汝の知るところにあらず
That is none of your business―no business of yours.
女童の知るところにあらず
What has woman to do with such affairs?
彼の説くところ極めて明瞭
His explanations are quite clear.

content:
〈助動詞〉
1. (=何々するところ)going

content.content: 今手紙を書くところだ
I am going to write a letter.
手紙を書いているところだ
I am writing a letter.
今出かるところだ
I am going out.
学校へ行くところだ
I am going to school.
君に聞こうと思っていたところだった
I was going to ask you.
寝ようと思っていたところだった
I was going to bed.
今行くところです
I am coming.
すんでのことに溺死するところだった
I came near being drowned.
僕は彼の教えるところを見た
I have seen him teach.
現に金を取るところを見付けてやった
I caught him (in the act of) stealing the money.
彼に河で死ぬところを助けられた
He rescued me from drowning.
女が焼け死ぬところを助けてやった
I rescued her from the flames.
彼は汽車から下りるところをつかまった
He was apprehended as he was getting out of the train.

content: 2. (=何々すべきところ)ought; should; would

content.content: 私の方からお礼を申すところです
I ought to thank you.
今ひと奮発というところだった
You should have made another effort.
彼は金を出すべきところだった
He should have given the money.
紳士ならその金を出すところだ
A gentleman would give the money.
日本人なら死ぬところだ
A Japanese would commit suicide.

content:
〈副〉
1. Where

content.content: 君は彼の居る所を知っているか
Do you know where he lives?
彼の行く所はわかっている
I know where he is going.
もとあった所へ置く
Leave it where it was―Leave it where you found it.
かゆいところを掻く
to scratch where one itches
ここが我々意見の違うところだ
This is where we differ.
君の行く所ならどこへでも行く
I will go wherever you go.

content: 2. (=で) upon this, hereupon; upon that, thereupon; upon which, whereupon; then; well

content.content: ところで彼は逃げ出した
Hereupon he took to his heels.
ところで彼は真黒くなって怒った
Thereupon he became black with anger.
ところで僕は証拠物件を出した
Whereupon I produced the evidence.
ところでどうだろう、とどまって下さるわけにはいくまいか
Very well, then, couldn't you make it convenient to stay?

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. So far from

content.content: 彼を賞めるどころかかえって非難しなければならぬ
So far from praising him, I must positively blame him.
彼は手助けどころかかえって邪魔者だ
So far from being a help to me, he is a positive encumbrance.
ぜいたくどころか非常な節倹家だ
So far from being extravagant, he is extremely frugal.
彼は仏独どころか英語も知らぬ
He does not know English, to say nothing of French or German.
彼は馬車どころか俥にも乗らない
He does not ride in a ricksha, not to speak of a carriage―let alone a carriage.

content: 2. (=は) about; as for; as to

content.content: 金のところはどうかしよう
I will manage about the money.
給料のところはどうでもなる
I can manage about the salary.
報酬のところは君にお任せする
As for the remuneration, I will leave it to you.
入費のところはどうか都合しよう
As to the expense, I will find it somehow.
学力だけは確かだが授業のところは断言できぬ
I am sure of his scholarship, but I can not be positive about his teaching.
元金は払いますが利息のところは負けて下さるまいか
I will pay the principal, but couldn't you take off the interest?

content: 3. (=でない) far from

content.content: 彼の英語は完全どころでない
His English is far from perfect―anything but perfect.
彼は若いどころでない
He is far from young.
有りそうなどころでない(殆ど確実)
It is more than probable.
彼は学者どころでない(ちっともできない)
He is no scholar.
今は見物どころでない
This is no time for sight-seeing.
熱いどころの騒ぎでない
“Hot” is no name for it.
あの人を知っているかって知っているどころでない(大知り)
Do I know that man? I should rather think so.
これができるかってできるどころでない(大でき)
Can I do it? Yes, rather.

content:
〈接続詞〉
1. (=で) even if; granting that; no matter (who, what, etc.)

content.content: 損をしたところで知れたものだ
Even if I were to lose, it would be a trifle.
負けたところで恥にはならぬ
Even if I were to lose, it would be no disgrace.
今から行ったところでもう間に合わない
Even if I were to go now, I should be too late.
全力を出したところで彼に勝てる見込みが無い
Even if I were to do my best, I should stand no chance against him.
目的は好いとしたところでそんな手段を用いてよいものか
Granting that the end is good, can you justify such means?
彼が酩酊していたとしたところでそれで言い訳が立つか
Granting that he was drunk, is that an excuse for his behaviour?
誰がやったところで失敗にきまっている
No matter who may try,―Whoever may try,―he is sure to fail.
彼は何をしたところで成功はおぼつかない
No matter what he may do,―Whatever he may do,―success is doubtful.
泣いたところでしかたがない
It is no use crying―Crying will not help matters.
いまさら悔いたところでしかたがない
It is no good regretting―Regrets will not mend matters.
いまさらどう言ったところがしかたがない
It is no use talking now―Talking will not help matters now.
多く見たところで百万はあるまい
He can not be worth a million,at most.

content: 2. (=が) but; while; on the contrary

content.content: ところが大違いだ
But you are wide of the mark―On the contrary, it is quite otherwise.
今度は大丈夫と思って安心していたところが失敗した
While I imagined myself quite safe, I failed.

content: 〈特例〉

content.content: 今のところは何も不都合は無い
Nothing is wrong at present.
今までのところでは万事好都合だ
All has gone well so far―thus far.
見たところは立派だ
It appears fine.
ちょっと見たところでは本当らしい
It seems true at first sight.
僕の知っているところではそういう人では無いようだ
There is no such man that I know of.
僕の覚えているところでは彼は洋行はしないようだ
He has never been abroad that I remember.
惜しいところでおしまいになった
It ended all too soon―but too soon.
察するところ彼は金でも借りたいのだろう
He wants to borrow money, I suppose.
人の居るところで彼はそんな真似をした
He did it in the presence of people.
行くところまで行こう
I will go the whole length―I will go the limit.
やるところまでやれ
Fight it out!
手の舞い足の踏むところを知らず
I was transported with joy―in a transport of joy.
恐懼措く処を知らず
I am filled with awe.
皆歎賞措く処を知らず
Everybody was filled with admiration―lost in admiration.

content:
ところ〔所、処〕
〈名〉
1. (=場所)a place:(狭い処)a spot:(出来事のありし処)a scene:(建物のある処)a site:(人や物の入る処)room

content.content: 仙台はどんな処か
What sort of a place is Sendai?
眠むたい処だ
It is a dull place.
僕の生まれた処だ
It is the place where I was born.
ここは昔戦いのあった処だ
This is the scene of a battle.
実物の隠してある処を知っているか
Do you know the place where the treasure is buried?
処をくわしく知っている
I know the exact spot.
ここは若い者を置く処じゃない
This is no place for a young man.
どんな物でもそれぞれ用い処がある
Everything is useful in its place.
どんな人でもそれぞれ用い処がある
Everyman is useful in his way.
所を得る
to be in one's place―in one's element
彼は所を得ぬ
He is out of his place―out of his element―a square peg in a round hole―a fish out of water.
僕の入る処があるか
Is there room for me?
もう入る処が無い
There is no room for more.
いま一人だけ入る処がある
There is room for one more.
ここが今度の学校の建つ処だ
This is the site of the new school.
ここは昔城があった処だ
This is the site of an old castle.
痛い処へ触れる
to touch one on a sore spot
彼は処嫌わずにしゃれる
He is witty in place and out of place―in season and out of season.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 出物腫れ物所嫌わず

こんな所へ来るんじゃなかった

そんな所に何をしているか

あんな所へ誰が行くものか

呼んだら聞こえる所におれ

彼は波の音の聞こえる所に居る

船は陸の見える所へ来た

敵艦は大砲の届く所へ来た

石を投げたら届く所にある
It is within a stone's throw.
所変われば品変わる
“Each country has its own customs.”

a stranger

手の舞い足の踏むところを知らず
I was transported with joy―in a transport of joy.
恐懼措く処を知らず
I am filled with awe.
皆歎賞措く処を知らず
Everybody was filled with admiration―lost in admiration.

content:
ところえがお〔所得顔〕
〈名〉A triumphant countenance; a proud look

content.content: 彼は所得顔で帰って来た
He returned in triumph.
花が所得顔に咲き誇っている
The flowers are blooming in all their pride.

content:
どころか
〈前置詞相当〉
1. So far from

content.content: 彼をほめるどころかかえって非難しなければならぬ
So far from praising him, I must positively blame him.
彼は手助けどころかかえって厄介者だ
So far from being a help to me, he is a positive encumbrance.
彼はぜいたくどころか非常な節倹家だ
So far from being extravagant, he is extremely frugal.

content: 2. Not to mention; not to speak of; to say nothing of; let alone

content.content: 彼は独語仏語どころか英語も知らぬ
He knows no English, to say nothing of German or French.
彼は馬車どころか俥にも乗らぬ
He does not ride in a kuruma, not to speak of a carriage.
彼はぜいたくどころか日用品にも困っている
He wants the bare necessaries of life, not to mention luxuries―let alone luxuries.

ところがき〔所書き〕
〈名〉One's address

content:
どころでない
〈前置詞相当〉
1. Far from

content.content: 彼の英語はまだまだ完全どころでない
His English is far from perfect.
彼は若いどころじゃない、五十になんなんとする中老人だ
So far from being young, he is an elderly man close on fifty.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: ありそうなどころでない、ほとんど確実だ
It's more than probable―almost certain.
熱いどころでない
“Hot” is no name for it.
面白いどころでない
“Interesting” is no name for it.
あの人を知っているかって、知っているどころでない(大知り)
Do I know him? I should rather think so―Yes, rather.
これができるかって、できるどころでない(大でき)
Can I do it? Yes, rather.
今は見物どころでない
This is no time for sight-seeing.
遊びどころでない
This is no time for pleasure.
彼は学者どころでない(ちっともできない)
He is no scholar (at all).

content.content: 心太草
Gelidium

〈副〉In places; here and there

content.content: 漆が処々はげている
The lacquer is off in places.
雪が処々に残っている
The snow remains here and there.

content.content: 彼は村を所払いになった

〈名〉A local custom

content:

〈副〉In spots

content.content: 雪が処斑に残っている
The snow still remains in spots.

content:
どざえもん〔土左衛門〕
〈名〉A drowned person; a drowned body

content.content: 男の土左衛門は仰向きに浮く
A drowned man floats on his back.
女の土左衛門はうつ向きに浮く
A drowned woman floats on her face.

content:
とさか〔鳥冠〕
〈名〉The comb (of a cock); the cockscomb; the crest (of a bird)

content.content: とさかのある鳥
a combed fowl―a crested bird

content:
ドサクサ
〈名〉Bustle; confusion:(=する) to be in a bustle; to be in confusion

content.content: 家の中はドサクサしている
The house is in a bustle.
ドサクサまぎれに逃げ果した
I benefited by the confusion to make good my escape.

content:
とざす〔閉す、鎖す〕
〈他動〉
1. To close; to shut; to lock; to fasten

content.content: 戸を閉ざす
to shut door―(鍵を掛けるの意味なら)―lock the door―(戸締まりの意味なら)―fasten the doors―secure the doors
門を閉ざして人を入れぬ
to shut the door to people
人を入れて戸を閉ざす
to lock the door on a man
門を閉ざして出ず
He secludes himself from the world.
港口を閉ざす
to block the entrance to a harbour
ウラジオストック港は冬は氷に閉ざされる
Vladivostok is ice-bound in winter.
閉ざさぬ御代
a reign in which people slept with open doors―the Golden Age
一家は愁雲に鎖ざされている
The family is plunged in grief.
悲報に接して一座は愁雲に鎖ざされた
The sad news cast a gloom on the company.
彼の胸は不安に鎖ざされた
He felt ill at ease.

content:
とざす〔閉す、鎖す〕
〈他動〉
1. To close; to shut; to lock; to fasten

content.content: 戸を閉ざす
to shut door―(鍵を掛けるの意味なら)―lock the door―(戸締まりの意味なら)―fasten the doors―secure the doors
門を閉ざして人を入れぬ
to shut the door to people
人を入れて戸を閉ざす
to lock the door on a man
門を閉ざして出ず
He secludes himself from the world.
港口を閉ざす
to block the entrance to a harbour
ウラジオストック港は冬は氷に閉ざされる
Vladivostok is ice-bound in winter.
閉ざさぬ御代
a reign in which people slept with open doors―the Golden Age
一家は愁雲に鎖ざされている
The family is plunged in grief.
悲報に接して一座は愁雲に鎖ざされた
The sad news cast a gloom on the company.
彼の胸は不安に鎖ざされた
He felt ill at ease.

content:
とさつ〔塗擦〕
〈名〉Embrocation; inunction:(=する) to embrocate; to rub in

content.content: 塗擦剤
an embrocation

content:
とさつ〔屠殺〕
〈名〉Butchery; slaughter:(=する) to butcher, slaughter (cattle, etc.)

content.content: 屠殺場
a slaughter-house―a butchery―shambles
屠殺者
a butcher
屠殺業
butchery (business or trade)

とざまだいみょう〔外様大名〕
〈名〉An outside lord (of the Tokugawa regime, as opposed to Fudai, an inside lord)

〈副〉Heavily; with a thud

content.content: ドサリと落ちる
to fall with a thud
ドサリと椅子にかける
to sink into a chair

content:
どさりと〔ドサリと〕
〈副〉Heavily; with a thud

content.content: ドサリと落ちる
to fall with a thud
ドサリと椅子にかける
to sink into a chair

content:
とざん〔登山〕
〈名〉Ascent of a mountain; mountaineering; mountain-climbing:(=する) to ascend a mountain; to climb a mountain; to go up a mountain; to make an ascent of a mountain

content.content: 富士登山
the ascent of Mt. Fuji
富士登山をする
to ascend Mt. Fuji―make an ascent of Mt. Fuji
もとは女人の富士登山を禁じたものだ
Formerly, women were prohibited from ascending Mt. Fuji.
登山熱が盛んだ
Mountaineering is all the rage.
登山者、登山家
a mountain-climber―a mountaineer
登山期
the mountaineering season
登山杖
an alpenstock

どさん〔土産〕
〈名〉A local product

content:
とし〔都市〕
〈名〉Cities; towns and cities; urban communities:(=の) municipal; urban

content.content: 都市計画
a city-plan―city-planning
都市の発達
the growth of cities
都市生活
city life―urban life

content:
とし〔年〕
〈名〉
1. (=何年の年)a year

content.content: 年が改まる
The year changes.
年が明ける
The year begins―The New Year opens.
年が暮れる
The year comes to an end―The Old Year comes to a close.
年の始めに
at the beginning of the year
年の暮れに
at the end of the year―at the close of the year
年を迎える
to greet the New Year―hail the Coming Year―ring in the New Year
年を送る
to send off the Old Year―speed the Parting Year―ring out the Old Year
年を越す
to send off the Old Year and greet the New―ring out the Old Year and ring in the New
富士山の頂上で年を越した人がある
Some one wintered at the summit of Mt. Fuji.
このリンゴは年を越せるか
Will these apples keep over the winter?
年がたつ
Years pass―Years elapse―Years go by.
年がたつと人が忘れる
People will forget in the course of years.
年がたつに従って確信が固くなった
My conviction become firmer as the years went by―with the lapse of years.
語学の必要は年と共に加わる
The study of languages becomes more and more important every year.
年の市
the New Year's fair (held at the close of the old year)

content: 2. (=年齢)age; years; one's time of life

content.content: お年はいくつ
How old are you?―What is your age?
年は十
I am ten―ten years old―ten years of age.
十五の年に国を出た
I left home when I was fifteen (years old―years of age)―at fifteen (years old―years of age)―at the age of fifteen.
彼は僕より年上だ
He is older than I―He is my senior.
僕は彼より年下だ
I am younger than he―I am his junior.
年を取る
to grow old―grow older―advance in years
年を一つ取る
to grow a year older
年を取るほど智慧が付く
The older one grows, the wiser one becomes―One will grow wiser with age.
年が寄る、年が長ける
to age―grow old―advance in years
親父は年を取っている、年が寄っている、年が行っている
My father is old―advanced in years―stricken in years.
苦労をすると年を取る
Care ages one.
彼は年を取ってから学問を始めた
He began studying at an advanced age―in his old age.
年を取ると子どもに帰る
“Old age is a second childhood”―“Old men are twice children.”
年を逆に取る
to fall into second childhood
年を取るとまじめになる
One will sober down with age.
年を取ると慾が深くなる
Age makes one avaricious―“Prudence is the only virtue left at seventy.”
美人も取る年で皺が寄る
A beautiful face shows the ravages of time.
彼は年を取って腰が曲っている
He is bent with age.
年を取っても腰が曲らぬ
He is as straight as an arrow.
年を取ってから病身になった
He outlived his health.
年を取ってから不幸に陥った
He outlived happiness.
年を取ってから名を落とした
He outlived his fame.
年は取りたいもの
Live and learn!
年は取りたくないもの
Lord keep my memory green!
年は争われぬ
Age will tell―Age will assert itself.
年には勝てぬ、年が利いて来た
Age begins to tell on me.
君達はまだ年が若い
You are still young.
彼は年は若くとも功労を経ている
He is young in years, but old in experience.
君は年が若いから働ける
Your youth enables you to work.
彼は年が行っているから働けぬ
His age disables ［prevents］ him from working.
君は年が若過ぎる
You are too young―Your youth is against you.
彼は年が行き過ぎている
He is too old―His age is against him.
君は年が若過ぎるからこの地位に向かぬ
You are too young for the post.
彼は年が行き過ぎているからこの職に堪えぬ
He is too old for the post.
君は年の割りには若い
You look young for your age―You look younger than your years.
彼は年の割りには老けている
He looks old for his age―He looks older than his years.
あの女は年にしては若い
She looks young, considering her age―She wears her years well―She is well conserved.
あなたはお年ほどには見えません
You do not look your age―do not look your years.
彼は年より気が若い
He feels himself younger than his years.
年は気
“Age is a matter of feeling, not of years.”
男の年は気、女の年は顔
A man is as old as he feels; a woman is as old as she looks.
あの少年は年に似合わず行き届いている
The boy is careful, considering his youth―prudent beyond his years.
君は年だけに偉い、年だけに賢い、年だけのことはある
You are not old for nothing.
この子はもう学校へ行っても好い年だ
The boy is old enough to go to school―He is of an age to go to school.
もうとうに学校へ行っても好い年だ
It is high time that he should go to school.
彼はもう独立しても好い年だ
He is old enough to do for himself―He is of an age to be independent of his father.
彼女はもう結婚しても好い年だ
She is old enough to marry―of an age to marry―of a marriageable age.
まだ結婚しても好い年だ
She is young enough to marry―not yet too old to marry―still of a marriageable age.
まだ結婚する年じゃない
She is too young to marry―not yet of a marriageable age.
もう結婚する年じゃない
She is too old to marry―no longer of a marriageable age.
彼女はもう子を産む年じゃない
She is past the age of bearing.
あの婦人は年がわからない、曖昧な年だ
She is of a non-committal age.
この年で、この年をしてそんな馬鹿なことはせぬ
I know better at my age―at my time of life.
その年で、その年をして、好い年をしてそんなばかなことをするものではない
You should know better at your age―at your time of life.
年甲斐も無いことをする男だ
You ought to know better at your age.
あんな青二才とけんかするとは年甲斐も無い
It is beneath your years to quarrel with such a stripling.
そんなことをしてはこの年に恥じる
It would be beneath my years to do such a thing.
あの年で働かせるのは気の毒だ
It is a pity that he should have to work at his age―in his old age.
あのお婆さんは好い年をしておしゃれを止めぬ
She tries to look smart in her old age―She persists in blooming into the midst of winter.
年の割りには派手造りだ
She dresses too gaily for her years.
僕はこの年になるけれども京都という処へ行ってみたことが無い
Old as I am, I never yet saw Kyoto.
彼は年が年だからしかたがない
It can not be helped, seeing that he is so old―He can not help his age.
僕は年のせいで物忘れする
Age tells on my memory―My memory fails me.
年のせいで目がよく見えぬ
Age tells on my eyesight―My eyesight begins to fail me.
お年のせいでしょう
It must be due to your age―Age must be telling on you.
夫婦にしては年が違う
Their ages are too unequal for them to be man and wife.
夫婦になるには年が違う
Their ages are too unequal for them to marry.
年を隠す
to conceal one's age―suppress a part of one's years
年を拾う
to take a new lease of life
年を腐らす
to wear away one's life―wear out one's youth
彼は何もせずに年を腐らしている
He is wearing out his youth in inactivity.
彼は死んでも年や出世に不足は無い
He died full of years and honours.
死んだ子の年を数える
to indulge in vain regrets―“cry over spilt milk”
年の功だ
He is old in experience―experienced and wise.
烏賊{いか}の甲より年の功
One will grow wiser with age―One will grow wiser by experience.
年忘れに一杯飲もうじゃないか
Let us drink in honour of the Parting Year!―Let us drink to the Parting Year!

書類はざっと綴じておけばよい
You may keep the papers roughly bound together.

content.content: 篤子刀自

content:
どじ
〈名〉A flat; a thick

content.content: はばかりながらそんなどじじゃない
Give me leave to say that I am not such a flat.
どじを踏む
to commit a stupid blunder―blunder―bungle
今度はどじを踏まないようにしてくれよ頼む
See that you do not bungle this time.

content: 〈形〉Stupid

content.content: どじなことをした
I have been stupid―How stupid of me!

content:
としうえ〔年上〕
〈形〉Older; senior

content.content: 君の方が僕より年上だ

三つ年上だ

年上の人を敬せよ

どうぞお年上から
Seniors first!―Seniores priores!―(こっけいに言えば)―Age before honesty!―Age before respectability!

content:
としがいもない〔年甲斐も無い〕
〈熟語〉Beneath one's years

content.content: あんな青二才とけんかするとは年甲斐も無い
It is beneath your years to quarrel with such a stripling.
そんなことをしては年甲斐も無いから止す
It would be beneath my years to do such a thing.
僕はそんな年甲斐も無いことをせぬ
I know better at my age.
年甲斐も無いことをする人だね
You should know better at your time of life.

content:
としがけ〔年掛け〕
〈名〉Yearly payment; yearly instalment

content.content: 年掛けで払う
to pay by yearly instalments

content.content: 年嵩の人

content.content: どうぞお年頭から

content.content: 綴じ方が悪い

content.content: 君と同じくらいの年恰好だ

皆同じ年恰好だ

content:

content.content: 綴じ釘で鉄板を綴じる
